39106864.review:
This game is probably the shortest game I've ever played, having completed story mode in just under 20 mins. The rest of the game modes are super quick plays as well. The gameplay is anything but complex and the maps are very basic. The graphics are right up my alley and there's a decent power progression (even if it is a quick one). Arcade bullet hell players will feel right at home with this one. 

It's strange but there's something drawing me toward the game, but not enough to keep playing for long periods of time due to the lack of content. Once story mode finishes, there are only time and endless modes left, meaning unless you want to perfect your playstyle for the game, there's not much else to do. 

The game is fairly cheap, so I suppose that justifies the amount of content you can expect, and for what's available, I would recommend it.

38257581.review:
[b]Savant - Ascent[/b] is essentially a bullet hell arcade shooter where you battle hordes of enemies - shoot, dodge by jumping between two platforms, and power up by collecting CD fragments. Savant – Ascent is extremely well polished but falls short in terms of content.

[h1][u]Positive:[/u][/h1]
[list]
[*]Both the graphics and sound track are excellent - the style reminds me of exceptional retro games, such as the Castlevania series. 
[*]At the beginning gameplay is very basic. You shoot/aim using your mouse, and dodge left and right using your keyboard. However, as you collect CD fragments, more abilities become available to you, making gameplay more dynamic and skill based. With these abilities in your arsenal, you will be put to the test in the endless mode and semi-secret story mode. 
[*]Since you have to deal with large numbers of enemies, I really appreciated the small details included to help the player. For example, there are indicators at the edge of your screen that show where enemies are coming from. There are also audio cues when a specific enemy (Fodders) hurl themselves at you. These are small details, but they really help you organize yourself amidst the chaos.
 [/list]

[h1][u]Negative:[/u][/h1]
[list]
[*]My biggest complaint is that Savant – Ascent is far too short. I would say that most players will be able to beat the main story line in about 20 minutes. It’s such a shame considering how beautiful and well made this game is. Upon beating the story mode, you unlock time trial and endless modes, so replay value lies in improving your high score or time. Needless to say, this gets quite repetitive. However, I did like that a secret extension of the story mode was included. 
[/list]

[h1][u]Conslusion:[/u][/h1]
[h1]★★★☆☆ You decide[/h1]
Savant – Ascent is not bad by any means. The graphics, sound track, and gameplay are done exceptionally well, but there just isn’t enough content to keep me entertained for very long. I don’t care much for improving my completion time or score, so the other modes aren’t very interesting to me. Instead, I would have loved to play through a longer story mode. If you’re the type to spend countless hours perfecting the game mechanics and improving your score, then Savant – Ascent might be for you.

37626860.review:
Right from the start, you feel like you are controlling an awesome, destructive power. The energy blasts are wild and the animation conveys a real sense of force. As you unlock power-ups, that destructive power increases dramatically. Once you are fully powered, you will tear through the first portion of the game with little effort. Fortunately, an expansion was released to bring back some challenge and you can start from any level that you've unlocked.

Controls are simple. Aim the curser in the general direction of enemies and fire. The hero is also able to deftly avoid incoming threats by jumping in place, jumping between two platforms, or rolling between the platforms. If an enemy drops a portion of a CD, highlight it and alt fire to rope it in. This is how to unlock power-ups and new music tracks. The power-ups add some more variety to your arsenal and they are straightforward to learn.

The biggest problem with this game is how easy it is once you obtain all of the power-ups. As far as I can tell, there is no way to selectively drop them. The samurai battle requires more rote memorization than strategy. There is, however, an endless mode that gets extremely challenging, although it always requires you to start from the beginning. Another problem is that, on Linux, GOTY mode is unable to load some assets, which causes the game to crash.

I am not a fan of mobile ports. Usually, they feel out of place on PC, but this one was done right. The controls work well, the visuals take advantage of a full sized monitor, and the soundtrack can be enjoyed with high quality speakers rather than headphones. I enjoy this game enough that it is one of very few single player games to which I return after clearing just to kill time. I recommend this game without reservation.

33998753.review:
[u]Premessa[/u]: 
Un alchimista studia un globo molto potente, in grado di fornire poteri incredibili.
La forza dell'oggetto è però instabile e sfugge al suo controllo, costringendolo ad abbandonare la torre e tutte le sue creazioni, diventate improvvisamente a lui ostili.
[u]Ruolo del Giocatore[/u]:
Voi sarete l'alchimista che tenterà di raggiungere la vetta della torre e riprendere il controllo del globo.
Per liberarvi dei nemici userete [b]dardi magici a ripetizione[/b] e vi muoverete nelle [i]poche[/i] piattaforme a vostra disposizione per evitare gli attacchi.
[u]Punti di Forza e di Debolezza [/u]:
Come potrete leggere a destra del mio avatar, la longevità del gioco [u]non[/u] è un suo punto di forza.
[u]Premetto di non aver completato tutte le sfide[/u], ma la parte relativa alla storia dell'alchimista è composta da pochi livelli, risolvibili con un po' di abilità in un'ora.
D'altro canto quella piccola porzione di tempo che ho dedicato al titolo è stata appagata dalla musica di [b]Aleksander Vinter[/b] (in arte [b]Savant[/b] ), ha reso ogni sfida più coinvolgente.
Le tracce musicali [b]possono essere selezionate ad ogni livello[/b] e acquisite nelle varie modalità in quarti di disco, ciò permette di avere una personalizzazione maggiore durante le fasi di gioco o nelle cacce agli Achievements.

[b]Consiglio[/b] a voi Savant-Ascent perchè l'emozione, [i]seppur breve[/i] , che ho provato giocando gli [u]permette[/u] di lasciarvi questa piccola storia e la possibilità di crearne altre, del tutto vostre.

Il [b]Bardo[/b] si congeda .

33917323.review:
Mi sono accostato a Savant - Ascent con aspettative forse troppo grandi per un prodotto che già a partire dal prezzo (2 caffè) non sembra mostrare pretese di eccellenza. Ritornato con i piedi per terra dopo qualche ora di prova, posso confermare che ciò che il gioco offre è assolutamente commisurato al suo costo: una breve quanto intensa esperienza arcade, corredata da una pixel-art di altissimo livello. Che comunque NON è poco.

In Savant - Ascent impersoniamo il mago Savant, spodestato dalla propria torre da una misteriosa sfera di luce. Nel nostro percorso verso la sommità dell'edificio dovremo affrontare ondate di nemici meccanici utilizzando la nostra magia. Una volta eliminati, alcuni avversari speciali rilasceranno dei frammenti di CD che potremo raccogliere e collezionare con un duplice scopo: in primis acquisire nuove abilità che andranno a modificare la nostra arma principale, i dardi magici, e secondariamente sbloccare nuove tracce da utilizzare come musica di sottofondo durante il gioco.

Scopo del gioco è distruggere nel più breve tempo possibile gli avversari che ci attaccheranno da tutte le angolazioni, eventualmente schivando con un salto o con un passo laterale (gli unici due movimenti possibili) i pochi che riusciranno a sopravvivere alla nostra salva di proiettili. Si tratta di un gioco in cui riflessi e velocità di reazione rivestiranno un ruolo molto importante, in maniera simile ai canonici SHMUP aerospaziali a cui eravamo abituati da bambini: un parallelo che regge anche in termini di difficoltà, che soprattutto nella modalità "Endless" raggiunge in breve tempo un livello veramente ostico.

Sul versante della grafica non c'è molto da dire, se non che la pixel-art in Savant - Ascent è decisamente eccezionale nel suo essere colorata, ben disegnata e - come direbbero gli angolofoni, con un termine che tradotto in italiano non rende bene l'idea - decisamente "crisp". La poca varietà di ambientazioni e personaggi in questo senso lascia un po' l'amaro in bocca - nota a margine: gli sviluppatori norvegesi D-PAD Studio riusciranno a farsi perdonare soltanto qualche anno dopo rilasciando lo sbalorditivo Owlboy. Ottima la colonna sonora originale di stampo elettronico scritta dal musicista norvegese Savant, che come il protagonista del nostro gioco ama esibirsi in pubblico con il volto coperto dalla maschera di Guy Fawkes. Coincidenza? Io non credo... (cit.)

Savant - Ascent è un gioco particolare: la modalità storia di esaurisce in meno di un'ora e da lì in avanti le uniche opzioni sensate saranno la modalità "Time Attack", in cui gareggeremo per terminare il gioco (di nuovo) nel minor tempo possibile, e una modalità "Endless" più hardcore, dedicata ai veri fans degli shooter. Non si tratta di un gioco per tutti i palati: tolto l'aspetto competitivo di migliorare il proprio record e l'esigenza collezionistica di sbloccare tutti i CD/potenziamenti, quello che rimane potrebbe essere troppo poco per il giocatore occasionale. Per questo, nonostante il prezzo molto contenuto, mi riservo di consigliare Savant - Ascent solo agli sfegatati degli SHMUP, che con una spesa irrisoria potranno aggiungere una variante semplice, divertente e visivamente appagante alla propria collezione.

[i][b]Se questa recensione ti è piaciuta clicca "Segui" sulla [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/retrogamingcafe/curation]pagina del Curatore[/url] del mio gruppo: sarai sempre aggiornato con i miei personali consigli e le recensioni dei migliori titoli indie/retro/roguelite in circolazione![/b][/i]

33081917.review:
A malicious orb has cast Savant out of his tower and transformed his surroundings into dangerous enemies! Dodge and shoot your way back up the tower, and blast down waves of enemies as you make your way towards the top!

Savant is a very tiny shooter. You could say it's short and sweet. You move your character between two positions and shoot enemies that appear on the screen. All that in tune with great chiptune music. After you finish the short story mode - two levels and a boss - you get access to time attack and endless mode. After the first hour you see everything the game has to offer, but it's great fun nevertheless. Kinda like Super Hexagon, very simple gameplay, amazing music, great in short bursts. For the price (especially on sale) it's a bargain.

I liked:
* music
* graphics

I disliked:
* short story mode

Get this if:
* you like shooters and are able to have fun with endless mode
* you like chiptunes (as even if you don't like the gameplay the music is great)

Don't get this if:
* you want to play this for the story

Phenomenally sweet if just a bit short on content, Savant is a grand marraige of bullet hell and great music that will do glorious things to your eyes and ears. The gameplay is precise and the challenge is truly viscious, but it belies that this game has about two hours of content to be found here. I loved every second, but I really, really craved more.

The best way to describe this game is four words: Old school arcade game.
It does not give you a goddamn chance. You have three lives, and once you get hit, it's game over, man, and believe me, enemies will swarm from every direction, so you'll need those hits. Did I mention you can't recover health? If you can't be quick on your fingers, you will not beat this game.
That being said, this is perhaps one of the most fun games I have ever played, with an amazing soundtrack, great visuals, and a simple premise that works, and works well. I would highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys Savant's older stuff, arcade games in general, or is just looking for an addition to their library they can return to time and time again.

30391660.review:
[h1]Arcade e musica elettronica con stile[/h1]
Comprato prima su iOS e poi qui, Savant - Ascent è un magnifico gioco arcade shoot 'em up davvero molto carino, con una soundtrack delle migliori canzoni di Aleksander Vinter, o Savant, un artista e disk jockey veramente con un talento eccezionale, purtroppo poco conosciuto qui in Italia, il quale secondo me meriterebbe davvero tanto per il suo stile davvero unico e introvabile in altri artisti della musica elettronica. 
La direzione artistica del piccolo studio norvegiese D-Pad Studio, diretta da Simon Stafnes Andersen, grandissimo artista anche lui, soprattutto di molte artwork degli album di Savant, e dove poco più tardi rilascia un platform meraviglioso, Owlboy, realizzato con passione per ben 9 anni.
Il gameplay è semplice, però ci sta davvero molto per questo genere di gioco.
E quindi niente, se siete fan italiani di Savant, amate le sue canzoni, e questo genere di giochi, allora fa proprio per voi, per videogiocatori e non. [h1]VOTO: 8/10[/h1]

29847614.review: savant e' uno sparatutto tradizionale, dalla bella musica, bella atmosfera, animazioni e sprite. il tutto pero' e' veramente sprecato, l'intenzione e' ottima e si vede, la passione c'e', e per quel poco che il gioco dura sa intrattenere. putroppo il titolo e' afflitto da diversi problemi, primo fra tutti: la durata, se siete giocatori abili del genere il gioco durera' anche meno di 30 minuti. il secondo problema e' il controllo del nostro protagonista, legato, vincolato da pochi moviementi, non ci sono alternative: o stai qui o stai li....letteralmente il personaggio si puo' muovere esclusivamente su due piattaforme per evitare i nemici, appiattendo cosi un gameplay a dir poco gia antico di per se'. infine piu' che un problema, una critica: avendo a disposizione una colonna sonora cosi' valida, e volendo fare uno sparatutto perche non puntare a uno sparatutto rihthm game? spero solo in un nuovo savant che risolva tutto questo, questo gioco ha potenziale.

29805644.review:
主人公を囲うように全方位に現れる敵を出来るだけ素早く倒し、攻撃を避けていくことがキモとなるアクションシューティングゲーム。
出現した敵の倒すべき優先順位を決めて的確に倒していくという戦闘スタイルはうまくプレイできれば爽快感があり、2D3Dの違いはあれど"Devil Daggers"によく似ていると感じた。
　このゲームに存在する足場は"右"か"左"の2つのみ。その2つを上移動か下移動で渡るだけというシンプルな移動方法な為、意識の殆どを射撃のみに集中できるというのが個人的には好感触。
敵の出現方向にはインジケーターが表示されるので感覚的にその方向へ攻撃を向けることが出来るようになっており、また1パックの敵を殺しきった際や生き残っている敵が攻撃態勢に入った際には効果音が鳴るという仕様になっていて、特に敵が多くなり操作が忙しくなるゲーム後半には視覚に頼らない状況判断材料として重宝する。

　ゲーム中には一応本編と言えるストーリーモードと、やりこみ要素であるタイムアタックモード・エンドレスモードがある。
タイムアタックモードは名前の通り定められた量の敵・ボスをどれだけ早く倒せるか競うモードで、エンドレスモードは次々と増えていく敵を如何に捌きながらどれだけ長く生存できるかというモードであり、どちらも最終的なスコアがランキングに反映されることになる。
　プレイ開始当初の操作キャラはお世辞にも強いとは言えないが、ゲーム中で「ゴールドCD」を入手することで次々にスキルが解放されていき、火力は際限なしに上がりキャラの反応速度も向上する。
育ちきったキャラの最大火力は初期状態とは比較にならないほどで、敵を倒すほど火力が上がっていくので最終的に猛火力で大量の敵を捌いていく快感を得られるようになっている。
また、ゴールドCDを入手するたびにプレイ中に流すことの出来る曲が増え、曲を切り替えることで新たな気持ちでプレイを再開出来る。

総評：
　作りはシンプルながら、プレイを快適にする為の工夫が多く見られ、殆どストレス無く遊べるアクションシューティングという点では手放しで褒められるゲーム。

ストーリーだけならばクリアまでさほど時間はかからないが、爽快感的にも難易度的にも本番はエンドレスモードなので、ストーリーをクリアしたら是非そちらに手を出して欲しい。
最初はゴールドCDの回収、そして実績として5分・10分生存という目標が用意されているので目指してみるといいかもしれない。

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=860352667

28884233.review:
When I saw this game on Steam almost a year ago, it was a pretty big suprise to me. A really cheap game made by the same studio that gave us Owlboy, based on the work of one of my favourite musicans? I just couldn't resist buying it, and man - that was a good purchase.

In Savant - Ascent you play as a powerful Alchemist who is very close to gaining control over a powerful Orb. Suddenly, the Orb violently throws him out of his tower, and takes control over his lab. Of course, our hero is not going to let some shining ball bully him like that, so he crashes back in, ready to fight his way back up. And so begins his Ascent.

Mechanicaly, Savant - Ascent is similiar to One Finger Death punch. You shoot enemies by pressing left mouse button, after gathering enough power can blast them with the right mouse button, and you can jump between two spots to dodge attacks in two different ways - either dash left and right  with A and D, or you can press W to do sick flips from one spot to another. You can also hold S to charge up your power metter, and that's it.

But there's so much more to Savant - Ascent. It's pretty much a bullet hell game where hordes of enemies circle all around you, and you protect yourself by firing [b]MAGIC MISSILES[/b] at a very fast rate. While this is realisticaly your only "weapon", this attack sounds, looks, and feels awesome. To make things even better you can listen to Savant's songs like Fat Cat Shuffle or Kali 47. If you're a Savant fan, you will really enjoy this game, and if you're not - you will still listen to some really good music while destroying hundreds of enemies.

Now, the thing with this game is that it's both a great stress reliever, and a pretty difficult game. Gitting gud might take you a while (and the game requires you to survive for a few minutes in endless mode just to unlock the final chapter, which is not easy to do), so you will probably get frustrated quite a lot. At the same time, Ascent is a very fun arcade-style game where you rack up huge combos and watch your score grow bigger and bigger while listening to killer beats.
If you just want to play a videogame that won't bother you with tough moral choices or 80 hours of epic campaign, and instead will let you have good 'ol fun like back at the arcade - Savant Ascent is for you.


In short, a very good title both for fans of Savant, and for people looking for a cheap arcade style game.

28869445.review:
To those who don't know.
Savant is an norwegian artist who goes with a lot of aliases: Vinter in Hollywood, Vinter in Vegas, Datakrash, V for Vinter, Mettaton, Blanco and a lot of others! He's known for having a extreme talent in making music fast! He seriously made a whole 1 hour and a half album in three months! Absolutely insane, he has a really dedicated fanbase and is beloved by many! So D-pad Studios made this game for him and the fans and at the same time promote his new album at that time; Savant - Cult.
The gameplay is fast-pased and fun! And challenging!
The music are many different Savant tracks! You can collect different CDs in the level and they let you get new powers and abilites, making the game even more fun! + you can change music later on in the game!

28339461.review:
彰显D-Pad Studio优秀的游戏节奏把握能力和低下的BOSS战设计水平的小品游戏。

两道切换+跳跃+单摇杆射击首先是对双摇杆做减法，以此来让玩家能专注在瞄准上。通过合理设置场景达到360度寻找敌人的效果，整体游戏的节奏始终很快，Juice的合理克制运用（D-Pad 的克制是再评论界取胜的法宝之一）会让整个游戏的视觉体验变得很舒适，同时操作频度其实再同样快的游戏里并不算很高，而听觉体验完全是Soundtrack的功劳。

CD收集这种为了重复可玩性加入的设计其实和这个游戏Arcade的本质有些冲突，但是在另外一层面，是对单场景对应一个BGM这种Arcade体系的再创造。至于成果如何我觉得不是很好，为了多变性而引入的风格变化对游戏本身的背景是一种削弱。但是因为游戏本身就没有多少叙事性，这种内容还是相对合理的。

28322758.review:
You awake at the foot of tower, checking
yourself for injuries after feeling you've
been hit by a freight train on a plane.

You straighten your robes and wizard hat
to see the moonlight cast your memories
back, and you remember what happened.

[b]SAVANT - ASCENT.[/b]

You were experimenting upon the stone,
the Philosopher's Stone, when it struck
you with lightning and cast you out. It
took control of your guard robots and
your grand inventions, all powered by
the grand beat of the funk. You must
return and take your rightful place at
the top of Synth Tower!

A short game but a rewarding one, 
comprised into three stages, and you 
know you're in the fight of your life. You 
need to unlock the power of alchemy to 
create what you needed... but you 
somehow cannot remember. Hovering 
robots with grinning faces and menacing 
guns greet you, their former master, after 
being overtaken by a sinister force!

But you are not without weapons. Being
a musical maestro, an [i]Audiomancer[/i], you
employ the power of beats as blasts of
energy against your former automatons.

You employ chains to grab and pull both
enemies and powered golden-discs of
the funk towards you. This was and still
is your house, this tower; and you will
show them who is the Master here!

After a tense introductory level where
the machines fail to overpower your
awesome might, the centerpiece of
the game is the seemingly-endless
grand elevator rising to the highest
level of the tower. More varieties of
mechanical enemies greet you, and 
you return their hospitality in kind
at the end of your chains and fist!

Blinking away as the last of the 
mechanical line of defence falls, the
elevator fades to a halt through a haze
of white. Coming to the ruined area of
the topmost level, the mischievous
daemon within, Vario [i](copyright 
notwithstanding)[/i] engages you in a
final battle upon you defeating his
mechanical wyrm monsters.

Finally, after that final duel, you see
the sun once more, the game comes
to a close. The menu gives you the
option to play [i]'Endlessly'[/i], where an
infinite amount of enemies and 
difficulty ratchet up and will end with
your death, or time attack, giving 
the game a modicum of replayability,
despite being simply Elevator Stage:
The Game.

With the free update, you fight the
insidous [b]MOON SHOGUN[/b] in [b]SPACE[/b],
picking up after the defeat of Vario
on the vista of your ruined tower.

It is there, after unlocking the final
achievement in endless mode, do
you realize what happened. You 
pause the game and look about,
and the house is in disarray, just
like the top of the tower.

You have regained your faculties
and your memories, just like the
Audiomancer Savant in the game.

You have reclaimed the power of
the Philosopher's Stone, to save
someone close, someone dear to
you. 

But it comes too late.

Months have passed since she left.

And all you have now, is the truth
of knowing that comes after wanting.

[b]SAVANT - ASCENT.[/b]

28263542.review:
Великолепная игра из жанра Инди! В наше время, некоторые недобросовестные разработчики выкладывают пустые игры с красивыми трейлерами, пытаясь привлечь любителей жанра, в результате чего у многих поклонников Инди-игр в библиотеке пылятся десятки различных недоделанных, да и попросту переоцененных проектов. Но данная игра - исключение. Как правило, в любой категории игр есть такие, узнав о которых однажды, мы начинаем сравнивать с ними все остальные, увиденные нами позже. Но и здесь данная игра приятно удивляет - как уже отмечали многие до меня, она не похожа ни на одну из игр, которые я встречал ранее. 
Сюжетная линия игры насчитывает всего 5 уровней (или точнее - стадий). Первые две - собственно, башня: выступая в роли алхимика, мы отбиваемся от толпы врагов, периодически выбивая из "золотых" противников кусочки дисков (CD pieces). С каждым собранным диском, открывается новый саундтрек (менять саундтреки можно прямо во время игры) с некой способностью, усиливающей нашего персонажа. Третья стадия - "Top of the Tower" - битва с боссом, после победы над которым разблокируются новые режимы игры (Time Attack и Endless Mode). Что касается 4 и 5 стадий, они открываются после второй (или последующих) победы над боссом, при условии, что вы уже собрали все диски. Более того - "финальная концовка" игры наводит на мысли о последующих обновлениях (прошлое обновление увеличило количество стадий с 3 до 5, так что эта игра - явно не из тех, о которых создатели позабыли, пробившись в Greenlight).
...игру разбавляют достижения. Ряд пользователей в обзоре отмечает, что игру "можно за 15 минут всю пройти" - но это не совсем так. У вас уйдет несколько часов на то, чтобы пройти все уровни и получить все достижения, без чего вы не сможете гордо заявить, что "прошли игру на все 100%".
Подводя итог, стоит отметить крайне низкую стоимость игры - 60 рублей. Пройдя всю игру (за исключением последнего, сложнейшего достижения на данный момент), я с уверенностью могу заявить, что купил бы её и за 250 рублей без всяких скидок за одну лишь её уникальность. 10/10.

26733549.review:
Un twin-stick shooter un peu particulier, qui est résolument arcade dans toute son implémentation. Le principal du jeu se déroule dans un concept d'ascenseur montant qui en fait un shooter avec des ennemis qui apparaissent, avec une petite spécificité, contrairement aux habituels du genre, vous n'êtes pas un vaisseau libre de vos mouvements, mais un personnage capable de se déplacer entre un nombre (variable) de plateformes disponibles, parfois avec plusieurs types de mouvement disponibles également. Le reste est très classique, il faut détruire à fond, scorer autant que possible en optimisant son score afin de monter en puissance, et éviter au maximum de se faire toucher afin de ne pas perdre en puissance (ce qui s'avère en général fatal dans les plus hautes tranches de difficulté). 
 
Graphiquement les sprites sont de très bonne facture, et l'ambiance musicale est elle-aussi d'une grande qualité si vous aimez l'électro. Le jeu est résolument difficile, et si les premières étapes pardonnent beaucoup pour initier au jeu, le terminer demandera une certaine maitrise du gameplay. Le jeu est assez court (en supposant que vous ayez le skill pour en voir le bout) avec une poignée de stages et quelques boss levels, mais exploite au maximum son faible contenu à travers divers modes de jeu qui vous fourniront chacun des unlocks parfois nécessaires pour atteindre la pleine puissance. 
 
Proposé à un prix très abordable, ce twin-stick shooter court et très technique ravira les amateurs skillés qui prendront plaisir à débloquer toutes les arcanes des quelques niveaux proposés. Les débutants eux seront probablement repoussés par un jeu qui ne leur offrira finalement pas plus qu'une intro "accessible" à refaire en boucle qui ne débloquera aucun mode de jeu leur permettant de s'amuser.

26312518.review:
[h1] About Savant - Ascent[/h1]
Savant - Ascent is a 2D twin stick shooter developed by small indie dev team D-Pad Studios. The game was made using GameMaker and won the GameMaker GOTY award for 2013, it also won Gullstikka Norwegian GOTY 2014. It’s got much replay value with beating previous high-scores and attempting to be ranked in the leaderboards. It is based on real-life EDM artist Savant (Aleksander Vinter), who also provides the soundtrack straight from some of his albums. Savant - Ascent is available on Steam, Google Play, and the App Store.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Shooting and dodging are the game's main gameplay mechanics. The player shoots a burst of bullets before the shots become rapid-fire, dodging and taking down mobs also builds up energy that make your shots stronger. When enough energy is collected the player can shoot a powerful shot that mostly one-hit-kills enemies.
There is a variety of enemies in the game, ranging from small ones with different amounts of mechanics to big worm-like enemies with destroyable sections. There is also boss battles, which are challenging if the player fails to notice patterns and are careless. The enemies come in hordes, and if they’re not picked off in the order they spawn then you may have some crowd control to deal with, the burst shots help a lot with that. Throughout the whole game there are CD fragments, four of which form one full CD. CDs unlock more songs on the soundtrack and also unlock different abilities and buffs for the player.
There’s Story Mode, Endless Mode, and a Time Attack mode. You unlock latter two modes by beating the Story Mode. In endless you can try and beat your highscore and also rank high on the leaderboards; same with the timed mode, you can try to beat your time and rank high on the leaderboards. Good old arcade-style gameplay model, which give the game a high replay value.

[h1]Sound[/h1]
For this game he chose most songs from his dubstep-sounding albums: Alchemist, Cult, ISM, Ninur, Orakel, Vario, and Overkill. Not including the musical scores made specifically for the game.

All in All Savant - Ascent  is a really nice Action Game! 

10/10 From Me
[i]Sweep	[/i]

25416679.review:
Savant - Ascent is a hi-octane, adrenalin-pumping, lightning-fast 2D bullet hell. I'm normally a plodding puzzle game player so this was quite a shock to the system. My poor nerves are still jangling.

You control a masked Guy Fawkes-esque character with a purple cape on a central platform with only two positions, left and right. You dodge and jump from side to side avoiding enemies coming at you from 360 degrees, shooting at them round the clock with unlimited ammo. One certain type of high-hitpoint enemy drops quarter sections of CDs which you collect by flinging your chain-grabber out, and at this point the action is frozen for one second. It doesn't sound like much but it gives you enough of a pause to target the next enemy.

After each 3-life death, of which there are many, the parts you've collected are pieced together and a whole CD awards you a powerup and a new song. You're resurrected at the start of the level you were at with your new abilities allowing you to hopefully progress further than last time. At a certain point you ascend to the next level (of 5) with ever harder, faster, more numerous enemies, culminating in a boss. I'm embarrassed to say I'm still struggling on level 4, it's bonkers! Please don't look at my hrs on record.

After level 3 Time Attack and Endless modes are unlocked for your competitive replay career.

[h1]Linux[/h1]

The control settings are a bit flakey in the Linux version. I did manage to get it working with keyboard/mouse at one stage after a lengthy session of plugging/unplugging devices and poking around in the game settings which kept reverting back to what I didn't want, but for the most part it seems to prefer a controller and who am I to argue - I'm happy as long as I can avoid having to boot into that other horrid OS. It works in fullscreen (at full 1920x1200 res) or window but I don't think anyone in their right mind would choose a window for this.

A point to note here is that most Linux-enabled Steam games these days seem to be made with Unity, which simply packages the Windows binary and DLLs with mono to run it all in Linux whereas this game has a proper native Linux binary and music files in open-source OGG format. I for one appreciate the extra effort even if it goes unnoticed 99% of the time.

[h1]Music[/h1]

It's all about the music. Having done a bit of googling I've learned that Savant is a prolific Norwegian electro/dance musician ([url=http://www.savantofficial.com/]check out the website[/url]); the whole game is based on his music and artwork. 6 striking tracks from various albums are showcased in the game and they are top quality, very catchy. Makes a change from the usual forgettable generic tunes in most games. In some places I noticed the enemies moving to the beat and maybe it would be even more apparent if I was a competent player.

[h1]Performance[/h1]

Graphics are easy on the eye but primarily designed for speed and efficiency. There are no overly fancy 3D or artistic elements, just well-designed functional 2D enemies that swarm in packs on a static screen. The result is a highly responsive twitch-reflex environment with zero lag. Any mistakes to be made are down to human error and can't be blamed on the computer, as much as I'd like an excuse for my pathetic scores.

Apart from the slightly flakey Linux control setup it all works smoothly, no glitches, no problems. The menu system is straightforward and includes an integrated achievements list and level selection.

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]

One word...

[b]DEAD[/b]

This is what appeared on my screen every 10 seconds for hours on end (and haunted my dreams) and for quite a while this was followed by "Highscore: 0". I was proud to eventually receive my first points. If there was an achievement for a bazillion deaths I would get it in no time. I daresay if you're a 14 year old with housefly-like reflexes you should fare better than I did.

When using keyboard/mouse, part of the challenge is keeping track of your aiming cursor which can easily become lost in the busy pyrotechnics of gunfire. It has to be placed near the CD part to pick it up. With a controller this doesn't seem to be necessary, you just pull the trigger and the part is retrieved even if you're facing in the opposite direction. The mouse does feel more natural though so it's a tradeoff.

[h1]Steam[/h1]

No cards. 14 achievements. I haven't managed to get any yet but hope springs eternal. Apparently some of these achievements tie in with the gameplay, unlocking new abilities. This is an interesting concept I've never come across before. Steam leaderboards are also included but I won't be troubling myself with that.

[h1]Value[/h1]

Everything about this game is tight and compact and the (full) price is no exception. The story mode, at 5 levels, is short but there's a lot of replay in Time Attack and Endless modes. Excellent value.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

This game makes me feel like a doddery old fart* who accidentally wandered into a rave party. I shuffled around on the dancefloor with lasers bouncing off my bald pate, blowing a whistle and waving a glo-stick, surrounded by a gaggle of attractive young ladies who said I was sweet. Now I need a nice cup of tea and a lie down.

I highly recommend this to all young whippersnappers in a hurry to shoot stuff.

* Disclaimer: JimDeadlock is an unfeasibly handsome bronzed adonis, in the prime of life and sporting a magnificent mane of golden hair. Fact.

[quote]This review is part of the Steamified Community Review program. For similar reviews and fantastic giveaways please visit http://steamified.com.[/quote]

This game was just, wow. I played it a while ago, a really short story with just 2 levels and a boss fight. It also had time attack and endless mode. I messed around with time attack for a bit. Overall, very difficult game, took about two hours to get good and beat it. Very fun. The one part that confused me, the ability list seemed to have some empty spaces, but I couldn't find any more abilities. In any case, I stopped playing there.


I wound up starting it up sometime later, poked around through the menus for no real reason, and discovered there were some more achievements I hadn't gotten. I think they said something about scrap metal? Unsure what this was about, looked around some more and realized that there were two more abilities you can get in endless mode! So I jumped in and damn it was hard, but after many tries, I fought through long enough to collect those abilities.

These two new abilities were... odd. Spin charging was cool, but still felt slower than shooting enemies... eh whatever. And then chain throwing. Very strange, you have to stop shooting to gain a full charge up while spinning, then you can throw chains to kill a bunch of enemies. However, it seems less effective than just using a regular charge attack, and uses your whole charge guage in the process. leaving you doing very little damage with your regular attacks. Very confusing, no idea why they would include something like that. To make it worse, they have this tendancy to fire off when you try to use a regular charge attack right after a spin, screwing you over.

Pretty much done, there was one thing still bugging me. There was still one spot left in the ability list, left blank, but none of the modes had any more to collect.

Leaving that aside, I decided to run through the story once more with the two new abilities. At some point during this, I realized that spin charging had hidden mechanics that made it more useful than I'd initially thought. But not the chains. I got to the boss and... well, discovered something I was not at all expecting...

Man, where do I begin with this game.  If I can say anything, this game has to be the most intense, hype, and energetic shoot em up I have ever played. 
  The gameplay feels smooth.  Playing with an analog stick, you feel like the shooting feels precise and fluid.  Any time you take down enemies, you feel like you're in power especially with the numbers you are taking down while still maintaining a lot of challenge.  
  Music is outstanding.  Savant is an artist that I love a lot with ISM being one of my favorite tracks of all time, makes taking down enemies even more hype than usual.
  If I can give a few complaints, it's that the camera moving to where you aim really throws me off.  If anything, the only reasons I felt like I died is not because of the enemies, but really more of the camera throwing itself out there.  I also wish that earning abilities when collecting discs happen during gameplay and not after you die.
  All in all, the game is still lovely.  I'm glad I managed to purchase this game while it was on sale and I would love to see D Pad make more games with Savant's name to it or even more indie titles as well.  They honestly have the skills to possiblly surpass Yacht Club Games as an indie team.

24624458.review:
Savant - Ascent é o jogo mais frenetico e lindo que joguei ate agora.

==================================GAMEPLAY=======================

Savant - Ascent você joga com um cara que pode atirar com a mão e vira robos por todos os lado então você deve freneticamente mata-los e desviar deles se alternando das duas plataformas que o jogo tem.

No jogo tera alguns robos dourados que dentro deles teram pedaços de discos dourados que quando você pegar 4 pedaços você completara um cd que esse cd alem de ser uma nova musica awesome para o jogo ela ainda te da uma nova abilidade.

================================GRAFICOS==========================

Mano os graficos desse jogo são lindos foram todos  desenhados

=============================TRILHA SONORA========================

A magnifica lindosa trilha sonora deste jogo foi feito por Aleksander Vinter também conheçido por Savant e é do apelido dele que vem o nome do jogo.

As musicas desse jogo deixam tudo mais frenetico e é uma melhor que a outra serio eu nem sei qual minha musica favorita desse jogo.

================================HISTORIA==========================

ATENÇÃO ALERTA SPOILER PULE PARA A PROXIMA FASE DA ANALISE CASO VOCÊ SEJA UMA PESSOA QUE QUER DESCOBRIR A HISTORIA JOGANDO POR SI MESMA.

A historia desse jogo é mostrada por imagens então você mesmo tem que entepreta oque elas significam.

Bem é mais ou menos isso que eu entend:i você é um tipo de mago e criou um tipo de esfera de poder para derrotar um samurai so que algo da errado e você cai la de cima da torre e você deve subir na torre usando os elevadores freneticos para  derrotar a esfera.

Quanto você chega ao topo da torre você tem uma batalha simples contra a esfera mas quando você derrota ela sai um ser da esfera e fala it´s me VARIO então você começa a lutar contra o VARIO que ele é uma mistura de mario com voz de warluigi e com o Zangado apos você derrotar o VARIO você desbloquia dois novos modos o time attack e o endles mode.

O modo time attack e so pra quem quer bater record mesmo nhe quem liga , e o endles mode tem mais dois cds para serem coletados e quando coleta-los você desbloqueara a abilidade de agarra inimigos e outra abilidade que não lembro qual é.

Apos você aprender como usar o agarra inimigo você deve ir na fase de luta contra a esfera do modo historia e usar o poder de agarra nela assim o poder da esfera sera seu e o jogo so continuara quando você pegar essa esfera.

Apos pegar a esfera você ira em uma fase que tera pedras flutuando e tera batalha com inimigos frenetico apos passar dessa fase você ira enfrentar o samurai que sera a batalha mais dificil awesome é frenetica deste jogo apos você derrotar esse samurai você finaliza o jogo.

==========================CONCLUSÃO EU ACHO======================

Savant - Ascent um jogo com otimos grafico otima trilha sonora tem uma boa duração e um bom fator replay alem de tudo isso ele ganhou premio de melhor jogo de 2013 feito na engine game maker.

E LEMBRE-SE DESTA FRASE AQUI: QUANDO VOCÊ ACHAR QUE ACABOU O JOGO NÃO ACABOU AINDA TEM MAIS E VOCÊ  TEM QUE DESCOBRIR OQUE FAZER PARA DESBLOQUEAR AS DUAS ULTIMAS FASES DO MODO HISTORIA.

24126673.review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

So first I was viewing the trailer for awhile. The game has a very intimidating appearance and rightly so. This game is not easy. I highly doubt there's many people if any at all that finished the game on there first try.  Actually the game is rather setup so you have to continue and die many times. But each time you come back you do a little better each round. Either cause you gained a new power-up or cause you know what to do. It does carry the classic syndrome of being put on tilt due to dying to the same thing over and over again. So you gotta deal with that. I warn you now if you're one of those people that dying to stuff you couldn't see, cause you dodged wrong, or your focus was on the wrong enemy. You're going to be frustrated and hate the game. Cause all this will happen.  Thankfully the game is generous enough to give you the option to start on the level you left off at. [spoiler]You thought Undertale Sans was hard you haven't played this then.[/spoiler] 

The best part of the gameplay is how extremely well it flows with the music. I feel like all my moves are controlled by the killer soundtrack. 

I'm also thankful for multi controller support. I didn't want to use my mouse or keyboard for this game. 

[h1]Music and Sound[/h1]

I love it. The soundtrack is just too good for words. You can find it on Youtube or some other place to give it a listen yourself. It works so well with the game it's like I'm conducting a symphony. I did have some issues with the game's music just suddenly cutting out at random when it loaded a boss fight at times. But it fixes itself. Honestly the best part is unlocking a new song to listen to. You can try all of them till you find your beat. 

[h1]Graphics[/h1]

Took me awhile to figure out the character's design. I didn't realize he was wearing a mask till I stopped and took a closer look. The sprite designs outside of the main character and bosses are pretty unique and memorable. This game does a great job keeping up with the action No sign of slow downs at all. 

[h1]Dissapointments[/h1]

These are rather minor gripes. The game is short. But what you expect for that kind of price tag? The difficulty does shoot up quite a bit as you progress. You have to bring your A game to the table. The extra ending might leave you wanting more depending on your taste. And I'm not really in favor of having to play the other game modes to get my last couple of power-ups. 

[h1]Overall[/h1]

This game is a great way to spend a couple of minutes. If you're waiting on something or someone. Just want to relax to some tunes. Want a challenge. Or you love getting high scores and showing off. This is your game. It's worth the small price tag and then some.

This game, oh boy. if you're a Savant fan, it's mandatory to own this, only the theme of the game was enough to make me buy this, it's probably the most fun, longeve, challanging gaming experience you can get for 2 €/$ here on Steam. You play as the Alchemist, the protagonist of Savant's most succesful albums, (wait for it...) Alchemist. Needless to say, the soundtrack is based on Savant's music, mostly from albums like Cult, Ism and Orakel. Sadly, there is only 6 songs to choose from. the gameplay is really simple. you can move between 2 platforms, you can shoot magic bullets out of your hand. Every 4 CD Pieces you collect, you get a new power, with a total of 6 CDs. the enemies' only attack being moving in your direction and hitting you. once you get used to the game, it gets real fun, i strongly suggest getting this game, Savant fan or not. 


the only personal problem i found in this game, is how once you get every power possible, you 1-hit kill every common enemy. i don't really like this, since when you begin to learn the game, every enemy has it's own movements, own attack style. but then, nope, you get override max level in like 5 seconds, and you demolish everything from about 3 seconds after they spawn, washing down the toilet every difference there is between them. but hey, at least once you get past the 5 minute mark on endless mode, it gets actually challanging.

23409314.review:
First off I would like to say that you should ignore all negative reviews by people that played the game for less than 2 hours. They are unlikely to have played the "full game" as there multiple hidden stages and modes, which admittedly can be tricky to unlock. This is because throughout the game you unlock 7 CD's that unlock skills for your character. 4 CD's can be unlocked in the main game and represent your basic abilities. 2 CD's are located in the Endless Mode, unlocked after beating the Story Mode once. Using these 2 CD's it is possible to unlock hidden stages in the Story Mode which (amongst other things) contains the last CD.

The progression of the game is pretty much designed to have you repeat some stages as the order of stages to unlock all CD's is the following: Story Mode (first time), Endless Mode, Story Mode (hidden stages). At the time of writing I have played for 5 hours and have gone through the Story and Endless Mode as well the first hidden stage. I have not even touched the additional free content that was added with the GOTY update and am definitely looking forward to it.

Another concern raised in other reviews is the playability of the game using a controller. I have beaten Story Mode with the controller however in order to unlock the 2 CD's in Endless Mode I had to switch to the keyboard and mouse. However I can't say I was disappointed, as switching to the mouse quadrupled my score. This is simply due to the precision the game requires later on in the harder stages which are incredibly fun to play and represent the main meat of the game. In reality the Story Mode and its 3 levels are essentially a tutorial that explain each of the mechanics in the game and after mastering these one is supposed to play the Endless Mode as well as the Time Attack Mode and the hidden stages in the Story Mode.

TL;DR Overall the game is amazing but fails to tell you that you are supposed to play the Story Mode more after unlocking some new skills in the other game modes. Well worth the price.

23296049.review:
[h1]Overview:[/h1]
Savant - Ascent is a 2D twin stick shooter developed by small indie dev team D-Pad Studios. The game was made using GameMaker and won the GameMaker GOTY award for 2013, it also won Gullstikka Norwegian GOTY 2014. It’s got much replay value with beating previous high-scores and attempting to be ranked in the leaderboards. It is based on real-life EDM artist Savant (Aleksander Vinter), who also provides the soundtrack straight from some of his albums. Savant - Ascent is available on Steam, Google Play, and the App Store.


[h1]Story:[/h1]
Savant has been expelled from his tower by an evil Orb, as a result he needs to shoot and dodge his way back up the tower, defeating waves of enemies as he ascends.

Higher up the tower are even more powerful enemies, enemies against which your skill will truly be tested. Are you ready for the challenge that lies beyond the tower?


[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]
Shooting and dodging are the game's main gameplay mechanics. The player shoots a burst of bullets before the shots become rapid-fire, dodging and taking down mobs also builds up energy that make your shots stronger. When enough energy is collected the player can shoot a powerful shot that mostly one-hit-kills enemies.

There is a variety of enemies in the game, ranging from small ones with different amounts of mechanics to big worm-like enemies with destroyable sections. There is also boss battles, which are challenging if the player fails to notice patterns and are careless. The enemies come in hordes, and if they’re not picked off in the order they spawn then you may have some crowd control to deal with, the burst shots help a lot with that. Throughout the whole game there are CD fragments, four of which form one full CD. CDs unlock more songs on the soundtrack and also unlock different abilities and buffs for the player.

There’s Story Mode, Endless Mode, and a Time Attack mode. You unlock latter two modes by beating the Story Mode. In endless you can try and beat your highscore and also rank high on the leaderboards; same with the timed mode, you can try to beat your time and rank high on the leaderboards. Good old arcade-style gameplay model, which give the game a high replay value.

Now, the Void Update.
With the Void Update a whole other section was added to the game, and this section is much, much harder. It adds more enemies with different mechanics, and it also adds a new boss, which is a pain in the ass to beat, to say the least.


[h1]Visual:[/h1]
The graphics are an overload of visual stimulation. The sprites are fairly detailed and animations are fluous. Explosions and shots are brightly coloured and debris and particle effects are eye candy. Amazing art. Just wait until you fight the space-samurai, just wait.


[h1]Sound:[/h1]
8-bit sound effects and Savant’s music make this game’s audio something unique but at the same time nostalgic. Aleksander Vinter (Savant) has savant syndrome, this makes him able to remember every musical sound he’s ever heard as well as make massive amounts of music in short periods of time. In his lifetime he’s made over 10,000 songs; since adopting the alias “Savant” he has released eleven albums, seven EPs, and twelve singles. He has no definitive genre or sound, and is constantly experimenting with his music.

For this game he chose most songs from his dubstep-sounding albums: Alchemist, Cult, ISM, Ninur, Orakel, Vario, and Overkill. Not including the musical scores made specifically for the game.


[h1]Final Thoughts:[/h1]
Gameplay this simple and this addicting takes ingenuity to develop. D-Pad Studios took a world based on Savant’s music and fleshed it out into a full universe. The Alchemist from the album Alchemist, Vario from the album Vario, and the Samurai from the album Protos.

Personally, I bought this game simply because I’m a huge fan, had ‘Savant’ in its name, and because the trailer was featuring his music. What I was surprised to encounter was a ridiculously fun game with an amazing soundtrack and crazy good visuals. A must have for Savant fans and twin stick shooters alike.

23234829.review:
1. This game doesn't have any pretense of being too long or involved and really isn't. The hour or so it will take most people to get through the story mode on this is a fun hour w/ really no dull moments. If you are fine w/ that, this game is for you.

2. It sort of feels like an old shareware title from back in the nineties where you got the first episode of the game for free and then had to pay to get the rest. Only in this case you pay up front and there is no more game when you're done.

3. Just kidding, there are actually two extra modes unlocked once you've finished. Not the same as more levels but, hey, it does add some replayability beyond just going for a high score. 

4. This game goes out of its way to call attention to its soundtrack but the music is only pretty good.

5. Graphics are also pretty good. 

6. Overall presentation strikes me somehow as just feeling very loud, almost feels like the game was designed to stand out in an arcade. I suppose the avalanche of indie titles these days does approximate the din of a packed arcade though so fair enough. I never would have played this were it not for the black metal sounding intro music in the trailer (which sadly devolves into some wubby techno). 

7. This controls better w/ mouse and keyboard than with a controller but it controls really well either way. There are definitely frustrating moments in this game but it's because you are a palsied and ill-coordinated nerd and not because you didn't doge in sync w/ your inputs. 

8. If you quit before you finish on your first session, you have to start at the beginning again but you maintain all your power ups so it's a bunch easier.

9. There is a weird mechanic in this where you don't get to use any of your powerups until you die. This would make for a great hardcore challenge--to beat the game w/o dying means you don't get to use powerups--but *spoiler* you can't kill the final boss w/o the first power up. I saw an explanation from the devs about this and it still doesn't make any sense.

10. Don't worry. You are almost certainly going to die on your first attempt and many times after that. Nobody who has seen the sun in the past fifteen years has spent enough time playing shmups to crush this thing on the first go. 

11. I dig that this is a Game Maker game. I once tried to make a Game Maker game to snowball into the indie game avalanche and only got as far as making a couple sprites flit about randomly while you shot bullets at them that did absolutely nothing.

12. Games don't have to be big and complex to be good. They just have to be good.

13. At the end of the day, my judge of an aracady shmup type game is if when I beat the final boss I give out my secret aracady shmup boss beating victory yell and I did that w/ this game. I call this a win for DPad Studios. I am looking forward to more titles from them.

23092881.review:
What a game. What a strange beast of a game. Part twin stick shooter, part platformer, Savant - Ascent is a whirlwind of color, music, and exploding robots. It's also incredibly bizarre as you play a Guy Fawkes lookalike alchemist whose goal is to retrieve an orb that has the essence of a purple Mario clone called "Vario" in it and...yeah. It's a weird game. But it's pretty fun, too, and that's important.

As you play Savant - Ascent, you hop from one of three platforms, dodging enemies and their incoming fire all while firing back at them. That's it. That's the whole game. It's super simple. As you progress through the levels, you can unlock record pieces that, when fully formed, not only grant you new music to listen to, but new upgrades to your own weapon. Very straight forward, but it works well.

Savant is extremely short, however; with determination, you can probably beat it in a sitting, 100%. It's tough for sure, but nothing patience can't fix. If I had a problem with it, it's that when you aim at an enemy, the camera pulls towards them, leaving you blind in the opposite direction. Expect many, MANY, deaths because of that. But still...what to make of the mish mash of steam punk, EDM, and weird Mario insertions?

Fun Fact: I was at work the other day (a supermarket) when I saw a customer walk by with a t shirt with this game art on it. I thought, "Oh, wow, that's cool! I didn't know this game was so popular!" I talk to him about it and learned that Savant is actually an EDM artist. The game, Savant - Ascent, is actually a strange side project featuring his music. IT SUDDENLY ALL MADE SENSE.

I think I got this for a dollar. Buy it. It's worth the one dollar.

22904338.review:
Tämä on niitä tapauksissa että peukutus voi olla ihan kumpi vain. Mutta pidemmän ajan jälkeen kun sitä miettii, niin sanotaan että hinta ei ole paha ja jos näkyy olevan alennuksessa, niin silloin peli on ihah harkitsemisen arvoinen.

Peli sijoittuu keskiaikaistyyliseen maailmaan ja tässä pelissä maat ovat laskettavissa yhden käden sormin, se ei ole kovin paljon se, mutta jokainen taso on edellistä vaikeampi ja pelissä pelaajalla on käytössään vain muutama liike; Kierähdys oikealle, kierähdys vasemmalle ja hyppy. Tosin tämän lisäksi pelihahmo osaa myös ampua energialasereita ja niiden avulla tuhota kaiken mikä yrittää kimppuun.

Tarina on kaikessa yksinkertaisuudessaan seuraavanlainen.
Savant lentää mystisen energiapallon vaikutuksesta alas tornistaan. Energiapallo säteilee energiaa ympäristöönsä, mikä synnyttää runsaasti vihollisia joita vastaan joudutaan nyt sitten taistelemaan. Ja niitä vihollisia on aivan tautinen määrä ja se määrä vain lisääntyy.

Savant – Ascent on erittäin lyhyt peli. Jokainen maa menee läpi minuuteissa. Olettaen pelaaja tietää mitä tehdä. Pelihahmo kestää vain muutaman osuman ja vihollisten määrä lisääntyy lisääntymistään ja jotkut viholliset käytävät päälle kuin herhiläiset. Nämä pelin muutaman tasot, ovat hyvin haastavia.
Peli on tarinansa puolesta lyhyt, mutta peli panostaa haastavuuteen joka tuntuu helposti murskaavan vaikealta. Pelissä ei ole kontrollien puolesta kovinkaan paljoa opettelemista ja peliin pääsee sisälle erittäin helposti. Kentistä löytyvillä kultaisella CD palasilla voi koota yhteen CD:n josta saa vähän lisää apuja matkan varrelle, kuten kyvyn saada hälytys siitä, mihin vihollisia ilmestyy.
Jokainen päivitys tulee tarpeeseen, sillä haastavuutta peli tarjoaa runsaasti ja tarinan jälkeen avautuu uusi kenttä, jossa kokeillaan vain ja ainoastaan kestävyyttä. Loputtoman vihollisryöpyn alla jahdataan sitä huipputulosta. Savant Ascent ei panosta erikoiseen tarinaan ja suureen seikkailuun, vaan räväkkään toimintaan ja pisteiden keräämiseen.

Peli on todella hienon näköinen ja vauhdikas. Toiminta ei kentän alettua katkea ennen loppuaan, se vain kiihtyy kiihtymistään, samalla kun taustalla soi dubstep. 
Graafiselta puoleltaan peli on kivan katsella ja lyhyet tarinapisteet ovat nekin ihan hienosti toteutettuja.

Kokonaisuudessaan Savant – Ascent ei ole mikään sellainen peli josta riittää pelaamista pitkäksi aikaa ja pitkiin sessioihin. Tämä on enemmän sellainen peli jota voi pelata aina silloin tällöin ja välillä pidempäänkin. Se on sen verran haastava että tarjoaa haastetta ja paljon toimintaa, mikä sopii erittäin hyvin lyhyisiin ajantapposessioihin. Ongelma vain on siinä että se että se haaste yksin ei vain ole tarpeeksi sillä kaiken sen alla, ei ole kovin paljon tekemistä.


+ Intensiivinen toiminta
+ Tyyli

- Pituus
- Vain yksi idea


Arvosana: 5/10

22082059.review:
Savant - Ascent is a two dimensional, action-packed, point-and-click, arcady shooter. It revolves around a mysterious figure, who aims to climb a tower in order to find the secret source of magic. Countless and diverse types of enemies try to hinder him and you need to help him getting rid of the evil forces that guard the philosopher's stone.

[h1] Design & Art [/h1]
The game is nicely designed and features an original gothical artstyle. The character and enemies look very detailed and well animated. In my opinion, the visuals were crafted with tender, love and care, they positively enhance the atmosphere of the game.

[h1] Controls [/h1]
Controls are pretty straightforward; you aim with the mouse and the game offers a tutorial for the moves you are able to do. Also, the Savant - Ascent features complete controller support, for people who want to play that way. Nice!

[h1] Sound & Music [/h1]
The soundtrack is what keeps this game alive. The game features a set of electronic/dubstep songs, that accompany you during your play. In my opinion, the music is really awesome and makes the game feel more arcady, even without repeating chiptunes!

Sounds are nice too. Overall, the sound of the game enhances the gameplay and lets you feel the action from start to finish. It really feels like you are playing an arcade game!

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]
The gameplay is kept simple: you, enemies, shooting, surviving. You aim in the general direction enemies are in and shoot. That's it. Disc parts you can find or unlock throughout the game will give you a new track you can listen to, but they also grant you a special power (more damage etc.). There are different powers and all of them make you somewhat stronger. Try to find all of them, in order to beat the endgame content this game has to offer! 

Chain up kills to increase your score multiplier and reach that sweet, sweet highscore in the leaderboards. But be careful not to get hit, since it reduces your multiplier, aswell as your lives. Three hits and it is game over for you!

Next to a small story, this game features and endless mode, in which you have to survive as long as possible (and consecutively gain very many points). Lastly, there is a timed mode for the storymode, in which you will need to beat the game as fast as possible. Small eastereggs are also included.

[h1] Weakpoints [/h1]
Unfortunatly, music is (as always) a matter of taste. If you feel a strong dislike for said music, I would advise against buying this product.

Be aware of the fact that this game is short and might not keep you engaged for a very long time. Fortunatly, the shortness is compensated with its price. Consider it a tasty snack you discover, so tasty you want to savor it by not eating it too often.

[h1] Concluding Thoughts [/h1]
Savant - Ascent is a game that could really be called a new age arcade game.

For a game that small in size and content, I really had lots of fun with it. The soundtrack enhanced my complete experience with it and kept my heart pumping and my head banging. The gameplay feels overly satisfying, wrecking some enemies with POWER OVERWHELMING has never felt that good for me. 

So you should definetly give it a try, because Savant - Ascent took the term "Brevity is the soul of wit." and "Sometimes, less is more." very literal. So literal, that I can't even believe I didn't spend more than two dollars on this game.

Friendly advice: Just be careful not to headbang too much or you'll wake up with neck muscle hangover the next day.

21035436.review:
I noticed Savant - Ascent in my library purely by luck. Like many other Steam users, I bought Savant as a part of a Humble Bundle and as with most of those bundles, a few games go unnoticed (especially if you have a massive library). Still I tried it and I was instantly hooked... for about 20 minutes. You see, for some reason (limited budget maybe?) the story mode of the game is only two levels and a boss fight, and while all three are challenging the first time around, still I finished all three stages in around 20 minutes. 

And it's a shame cause I really dig the mechanics of Savant - Ascent. Basically you control a character that can only move between two spots either by rolling or jumping. No there is no platforming, no level scrolling, nothing. You basically move between those two spots on the screen while shooting everything in sight until the end of the level. Get hit thrice and you are dead and you have to restart the level. Shoot enought enemies and you can fire a stronger shot that can destroy instantly multiple/harder targets. 

Simple stuff really, but done really well. The main problem is that there is so little on the plate here. Given the simplicity of the gameplay I would imagine making dozens of levels would be easy, since as said you never move in a level. 

Still, what little we have here is pretty amazing. The visuals are great, 2D well drawn characters, units and backdrops (not the "cheap" pixelated stuff we see on most indie games ou there), the music is amazing and the controls once you get used to them are pretty spot on. 

I would love a more complete product and even for the price I'm not sure I should recommend Savant -Ascent. It's like those classy gourmet meals you get at a fancy restaurant that you enjoy but never fill you up. If you have it in your library and never tried it, give it a go. It's a fun experience for the few minutes it lasts.

20947445.review:
Resumo: 

Um jogo baratinho e cheio de estilo que vale 2 a 5 horas de diversão...


-------------------------


Savant - Ascent é um jogo de tiro simples, um típico twin stick shooter que carrega o básico de todo bom shmup...

1 - Mecânica simples e firme com bom feedback sensorial
2 - Gradativa escalada de dificuldade
3 - Boa música

Estes 3 pontos estão devidamente ligados em Savant. Mecânica tem relação direta com a escalada da dificuldade que, por sua vez, é representada visualmente no subir do elevador e cada música destravada ao longo do jogo corresponde a uma vantagem mecânica para o jogador.

O jogo é rápido, não levando mais que 20 minutos para chegar topo com uma batalha final razoavelmente difícil de dominar. Dessa forma, o jogo acerta onde jogos como STEREDENN erram, você tem um jogo difícil com um percurso de tamanho ideal para manter o jogador interessado em passar por tudo novamente.

Mesmo sendo um jogo de 2013, não há motivo para não recomendar pelo preço total de R$ 4,29.
O preço é bom e Savant - Ascent tem valor.

20939874.review:
Este jogo tem uma jogabilidade simples, que exige apenas as setas/WASD para se movimentar e o mouse para mirar e atirar. Elimine todos os inimigos e desvie de seus ataques o mais rápido possível, enquanto você escala uma torre estilo Castlevania que, sim, possui um final, diferente de alguns jogos infinitos por aí (se você achou que a torre era infinita pois não chegou ao final, continue tentando). Possui uma trilha sonora fantástica para quem curte dubstep, todas compostas pelo Aleksander Vinter, ou Savant. O jogo é curto, mas pelo preço que ele está, não é algo muito questionável. Mas não se deixe enganar, toda vez que você "zerar" o jogo, a gameplay muda de acordo com o tipo de poder especial que você está ativado. Existem diversos endings escondidos que liberam poderes e músicas novas para o jogo, o que é bem interessante.

"Savant - Ascent" é um jogo que exige muita concentração, pois você deve focar em muitas coisas ao mesmo tempo, enquanto a tela contém vários feixes de luz piscantes e inimigos mais rápidos que você. Porém, se você curte este tipo de jogo e/ou gosta do trabalho e das músicas do Savant ( como eu :D ), você vai gostar bastante desse jogo.

20658858.review:
[h1][u]Summary[/u][/h1]
Savant - Ascent is a musical indie action 2D shooting thing. It took me 30 minutes to beat (with deaths), as it has 3 stages and some bonus stuff after that. It's good fun. 2 bucks is pushing it, but it does go on sale for 1 occasionally.

[u]Graphics-[/u]
Definitely pretty for what it is. Textures have a nice painted look to them, everything is stylized nicely. No complaints.

[u]Sound-[/u]
Music is a matter of taste. I have a pretty big range of musical preference. If you want to know whether you'll like the soundtrack or not, just look up the artist "Savant". I'm sure I'll botch the genre if I name it, everything has a specific subgenre and whatnot nowadays. Dubstep/electronic/wub wub. There you go.

[u]Gameplay-[/u]
Pretty fun. Gets relatively challenging, you might die a few times. Overall not super super hard though. Very short. Basically 2 stages where you collect upgrades and the like, and are almost expected to die in order to collect and use them when you restart the stage you died in. Then there's a boss stage that's pretty easy. The boss fight was kind of a bummer to be honest. He literally says (spoiler I guess?) [spoiler]"it's a me, Mario!"[/spoiler] upon arrival and it just rubbed me the wrong way as a really lazy attempt at humor. Other than that, the controls are pretty simple. On a controller you use the right stick to shoot, left stick to dodge right, left or up, RT charge shot, LT grab upgrades. After you beat the game through once, you get access to some after stuff. Time attack, endurance mode, etc.

Overall I'd give the game a 6/10 I guess. I don't necessarily dislike it, it was fun for what it was. But it's really only useful to kill 2 hours of time max, 30 minutes more than likely, which is why I can't honestly recommend a purchase. I bought the game for 99 cents during a steam sale, and even that might have been a little high.

20654053.review:

You have to like the music. Otherwise it's good fun for the money. Don't expect story or good graphics.

20462843.review:
A friend recommended this game to me, and I got it during a sale for 99 cents. I can't believe this game is so cheap for how fun it is and the replayability it has.

[b]Soundtrack[/b]
The music is great (I had never heard of Savant before). It goes perfectly with the gameplay, and gives it a great vibe.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
The gameplay is based on a limited movement shoot em up. You can move two directions, and jump. You get powerups through collecting CD's which give you new moves or give old attacks new effects. It's a lot of fun and you get into a rhythm when playing that feels really good.

[b]Replayability[/b]
As far as replayability goes, there are a few things to mention. There are multiple game modes (story, endless, and time attack). These add replayability, but there are also a few secrets to discover. And even after everything is done, there are achievements, and the game is just plain fun to keep playng.

[b]Overall Score- 10/10[/b]
I give the game a 10/10 overall. I was going to say 9/10 simply because of the length of the game's main content. However, for the price of the game, it can't be beat. Do yourself a favor and pick up this game!

20051768.review:
A bite-sized arcade-style shooter with simple but meaty fast-paced gameplay and quality soundtrack.

Your goal is to shower enemies with bullets and hop between the two spots to dodge their attacks, and unlock new abilities which gradually add more depth to the gameplay.
Story mode only has 3 levels which can be beaten in under 20 minutes. Most of game's mileage comes from replaying the levels for highest score, best time, or longest time alive in endless mode, as well as completing Steam achievements.

La musica no es muy atmosferica a mi parecer, mas es efectiva al inbuirte el sentimiento de persecucion y velocidad, en un momento tu personaje sera poderoso y tu lo sentiras gracias a la musica. 
El juego es un shooter del mas puro estilo arcade y aun teniendo mecanicas sencillas es desafiante y te hace mantenerte pendiente de lo que ocurre en la pantalla solo para encontrar ese trozo de disco que necesitas para poder consiguir esa habilidad que te falta. 

El arte pulcro y no hay nada que resalte de manera negativa. Una elexion de colores oscuros, grises y azulados contrastan positivamente con el purpura de nuestro protagonista; y un brillo metalico para todos los enemigos y todo lo que sea un objeto movible (incluyendote ti).

El juego dura unas pocas horas si es que eres habil, pero solo cuesta unos pocos dolares, y de hecho mucho menos de lo que esperaria que cobrasen. 
Yo no lo soy y aunque la maquina solo a registrado unas pocas horas ya llevo unos meses sin poder terminarlo. El juego requiere pasiencia y ritmo. Controla el ritmo que se esconde tras esa frenetica musica y lo lograras.

通常で200円程度ととってもお安いゲーム。
お安い割りに作りにかなり気合が入っており、音楽、ドット、ともに素晴らしい。

ゲームの内容は、２つの足場を移動しながら出現する敵を、ノーマルショット or チャージショットで倒すというもの。
敵の種類もあまりなく、シンプルなゲームだが、プレイする度に新しい音楽と能力がアンロックされる。

DubStepというジャンルの音楽を取り入れており、ゲーム内容と合わさってとてもスタイリッシュなゲームだ。
トレジャー辺りがこんなゲームを出しそうな雰囲気ではある。
一度クリアしたら、エンドレスモード辺りが慣れると１ゲーム10分程度なので、サクッと何かやりたいと思った時にオススメ。

なお、スマートフォン版も発売されてるが結構カクカクになる。

18867514.review:
Une perle exceptionnelle sur steam au niveau qualité/prix.

Si on enlève le mode endless (et le challenge pour le score) il a une durée de vie courte mais pas dénuée de difficulté! Pour ma part ce fut un coup de coeur donc je ne serais probablement pas très objectif dans mon évaluation ~>


[u]-La B.O.[/u]

Géniale! Si on aime l'électro, quoique Savant à un style particulier... Savant alias Alexander Vinter n'est (c'est mon avis) pas un DJ conventionnel et fait un son électro vraiment à part qui ressort très bien dans ce jeu développé pour lui faire de la promo en partie (Si j'ai bien compris D-Pad Studios et lui sont potes). Kali 47 restera une musique culte pour moi après avoir connu ce jeu (si vous aimez son style allez écouter ♥ un autre de ses sons mais pas présent dans le jeu)


[u]-Les Graphismes[/u]

Comme je le disais, une perle niveau qualité/prix, et ça se ressent dès les premiers instants de jeu. Personnellement j'étais plus trop sûr d'avoir mis que 2 euros pour avoir ce jeu quand j'ai vu les 5 premières secondes dans la tour... un choc.


[u]-La Difficulté[/u]

Ni trop dure, ni trop facile, au début on se fait défoncer très rapidement mais après un peu de persévérance ça devient jouable, mais c'est le jeu qui veut ça... l'Endless vaut vraiment la peine, assez bien foutu et nécessite un sacré skill pour faire du high score.


[u]-Le Gameplay[/u]

Simple mais efficace! C'est surtout la prise en main qui met du temps au niveau difficulté, notre vision est en partie obstruée sur le bord opposé à la visée et cela nécessite d'être un minimum vif et concentré pour suivre et exploser les vagues. On a un viseur dirigé par la souris (jouable à la manette aussi) qui nous permet de voir dans quelle direction tirer ce qui réduit notre visibilité du côté opposé et le tir est au clic, on peut se déplacer entre 2 plateformes (ou plus suivant le stage) afin d'éviter les tirs et/ou de couvrir la vague par un flanc ou l'autre, d'autres "compétences" se débloquent après récupérations de morceaux de C.D. (ce qui débloque aussi une nouvelle musique à chaque CD complet) et nous rend le jeu plus intéressant par ses diverses capacités à exploiter.


[u]-Les Bonus[/u]

D'autres modes de jeux sont disponibles si on réussi certains objectifs ce qui relève encore le challenge! La dernière MAJ et sa musique déboîte! (Void)

Edit: Encore une MAJ pour Halloween!


Bref je ne peux que le conseiller et espère qu'Owlboy sera bientôt d'actualité!

18560725.review:
[b]Well worth the price of admission.[/b]

When you consider that most commercial music costs [i]at least[/i] 0.99$ for a single song, the same price I paid for this game on sale, it really highlights the great value of Savant - Ascent. The soundtrack alone would be a steal but you get an excellent game too!

The core gameplay of Savant - Ascent is quite simple but don't let that deter you. Its fluid, pulse raising action is a blast to play. The difficulty curve is just right for most of the game but got a bit steep for my liking right near the end. A steady stream of unlocks keeps things fresh throughout the main story and avoids overwhelming you. This isn't a very long game but it includes a few extras like time trial and endless modes that will please you if you like a challenge.

My biggest complaint is that the final boss gets away from the frenetic gameplay and instead becomes an exercise in memorizing a static sequence of attacks. While the fight has an epic air to it, it lost the fun factor for me and became a chore to overcome in order to see the ending. Without spoiling anything, the ending suggests that the developers had more planned but it's unlikely that we'll see an expansion telling the rest. That is disappointing but considering that the story is told solely through short, nonverbal cutscenes, you can't claim that story was ever this game's strength or focus.

If you like electronic music you should enjoy the fantastic soundtrack. All the songs are accessible in .ogg format in the game's main files folder (typically C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\SavantAscent ). It's a testament to their quality that many of the tracks have found their way into my music library.

8/10

What to say about Savant - Ascent. First of all, let me preface this by saying I bought the game soley because it was part of a humblebundle bundle (called the game-maker bundle). I wasn't expecting much from it, and had one night gotten bored of all the games I had played so decided to load this one up. 

Pros: 
- Amazing soundtrack
- Great art
- Seriously, the soundtrack is amazing

Cons:
- The soundtrack is so good you will die while listening to it

18212384.review:
This game, this game! I've been wanting to play a game like this! A really simple yet so awesome game!
Alright, back to reviewing. 

This game is a 2D Shooter where your character (Savant) can only moves to one of the two available platform, where you can only dodge and shoot the enemy. Not to mention, the enemies came from EVERYWHERE, literally. "But if the enemies came from everywhere, then how are you going to dodge their attacks???" Don't worry, you got to kinds of dodge movement; jump and platform switch. Though there's no invincibility frame when you're doing that, unless you picked up a piece of CD from some fallen golden enemy. 

The gameplay is easy enough after you got all the power ups (or CD). But don't wish that you will easily get them all, as they're time tracked rather than random drops. (you should know between normal CDs and Power up CDs from their color) The last CDs, you can only get them in 'Endless Mode' by surviving for 4-5 mins if i remember. 

The boss battles? Well, they're quite easy after you figure out what you need to do. (Thou, the samurai boss battle is kinda hard, as he can just 1 hit kill you) 
The hardest level? Probably the void update's level, as you need to keep your ARSEteroids save from all the enemy that tries to destroy your platfrom by drilling it. 

Oh yeah, almost forgot to mention this one thing! This game's OST, 10/10, best soundtrack. Why? Because the OST is just full of Savant's greatest songs!(Imo) Such as I**, K4****, S******, and others. (Don't want to spoil you on this one) 

Well, this is just how this game from my point of view. 
Ofuya n'ya Outo

18149709.review:
Lorsque j'ai retrouvé ce jeu dans ma bibliothèque, je me suis dis "Tiens, aller, je le réinstalle. Je me souviens que c'était dur, mais bon, j'avais pas beaucoup joué. Je devrais m'en sortir maintenant !" Comme j'étais bête. J'avais oublié que ce jeu était une vrai torture pour mes doigts crispés à ma manette. En soit, le jeu est court : six niveaux dont le temps varis entre 5-15 minutes, mais c'est du bon die&retry, ce qui fait qu'une partie dur généralement près d'une heure et demi. Mais derrière la frustration, le plaisir du jeu est là : les niveaux se font relativement facilement une fois qu'on a le rythme et trouvé les techniques pour dégommer les machines, et d'autant plus simple lorsqu'on a finis par débloquer les différents CD, obtenant par la même de nouvelles capacités. Les soundtrack sont agréables, mais malheureusement, à mon goût, une seule musique correspond vraiment au jeu. Fort heureusement, c'est le premier CD que vous pouvez débloquer durant la partie. Pour le reste, le jeu est beau, agréable et on se laisse vite avoir par l'excitation de monter la tour en ascenseur.

Note : 8/10
Les plus : frustration compensée par le plaisir d'atteindre finalement le niveau suivant, le monde Time-Attack et Endless extrêmement plus dur que le mode Story et un jeu qui fera ressortir vos réflexes
Les moins : une seul musique vraiment en phase avec le jeu, du die&retry bien méchant et trop peu de capacités déblocables.

Savant - Ascent is not a hugely long game.  It is not a game with a real breadth or depth of play, it will not wow you with its graphics or sophistication.
