18125382.review: For a $2 game, it's pretty decent. The most important things to know going in are that it's a high score and achievement driven game. The more achievements and collectibles you get in game, the more your character grows in power. I personally still find some of the camera decisions poor, but they are at the least tolerable and only get particularly annoying in the endless mode. The art direction for the game is superb and I look forward to seeing more of it from this studio's future titles. The fact that some of the non-obvious secrets lead to essential power-ups for post-game content is a bit unforgiving. However, this problem is easily corrected by just checking one of the Steam guides when you get frustrated with why you are having so many problems while this game is sitting at 95%+ positive reviews. The final boss design is pretty terrible, though - one-hit kills until you slog through the pattern once and realize what you are doing wrong at each step. Then you just have to sit through it until you can deal enough damage to the boss to make it stop. And while I appreciate that the soundtrack is mutable (you will need to do this after about 5 minutes), the final boss music still plays. Maybe a bug, but it's stupid to give players the option to mute the music and then force it to play regardless. Overall, $1-2 game - it's pretty good if you reference a guide when you start having problems. I've had this sitting in my 'junk' category for a couple of years and it turned out to be all right when I went to mine some trading cards.

17546795.review:
Being a huge fan of Savant for many years now, I just had to get this game, and I can definitely say it was worth a lot more than the $1.99 I paid. For those who don't know, Savant is an electronic musician who composes in countless genres and has an extremely fast output rate with well over 10,000 tracks composed in his lifetime.

Pros: 
- Tons of replayabiilty with time attack mode, and endless mode.
- Outstanding soundtrack.
- Worldwide leaderboards.
- Very challenging boss battle with the Samurai that requires you to memorise his moves.
- Great design on the stages - has a gothic feel like the Cult album artwork.

Cons: 
- Can be a bit hard to get all the cd's at first, but when you do the game is even more fun.
- Only 7 of Aleks tracks featured in the game. Please add more soon!!

Summary:
I strongly recommend this game to anyone hesitant to get it. It's a fantastic price for a fantastic game, and who knows, maybe after a listen to the soundtrack you'll also become a fan of Savant!

PS: Please add trading cards!! It would make this game perfect.

I nominated this game for ' The “Villain Most In Need Of A Hug” Award', let's face, Vario is just misunderstood and really is a nice guy!

The game has a poorly implemented story campaign for a somewhat well thoughtout and visually appealing arcade score-attack shooter. The limited scope Asteroids style game-play is certainly designed for touch-pad gaming, and translates well enough for PC. However there are moments where I found myself in situations where I couldn't make use of the game's dodge mechanics. Then I found the game ended up being balanced around powers acquired later in the story mode. The bosses is an poorly implemented and often times unfair challenge for the player, and can boil down to rote memorization at times. 

If you get this game just get it for a five-minute time-waster of some kind. The game's soundtrack is varied and enjoyable to an extent.

16578990.review:
This game is really amazing ! Really nice indie game made in GameMaker Studio. Graphics makes this game more retro-styled and it's awesome. Plus, you can collect in-game disc parts and once you have full disc, you will unlock Savant track. Perfectly suited for every battle, every level and you will feel so strong and powerful. Wait. No.. You ARE strong and powerful ! Crushing every enemy with super-powers obtained from discs. Sadly this game is short, BUT, with the new Void update it's slightly longer ! Because, Vario boss was hard for the first time, but if you know what to do, you can easily beat him. And with powers from discs even faster. However, 2 new stages including Void boss has been added with an amazing soundtrack called Overkill. Void is really, really hard to beat and it will take it some time, to learn what to do, and how to NOT get killed. Then, there's a way to obtain ultimate power, endless mode, time attack, and Vario mode. There was also GOATY mode, but they removed it (Maybe it's hidden somewhere, who knows). Well, as I said, it's really fun and cheap ! So if you have 2€, you love epic (dubsteppish) soundtracks, you are bored or perhaps you have nothing to play and you don't know what to buy, this game is for you ! 
10/10

16085664.review:
Savant - Ascent ist ein weiterer Beweis dafür, dass ein Spiel kein komplexes Gameplay, open world, wahnsinns Grafik oder tausende Fähigkeiten und Charaktere braucht um gut zu sein.
Die Steuerung ist knackig, der Grafikstil im Retrolook konsequent umgesetzt und das Spieltempo hoch. Es gibt kein Tutorial, es werden einem nicht ständig Dinge erklärt, auf die man auch selbst kommen kann und wenn man stirbt ist das Spiel vorbei. Dann muss man ab dem letzten Checkpoint neu beginnen. Für wen das alles positive Eigenschaften sind, für den stellt auch der stellenweise etwas herausfordernde Schwierigkeitsgrad kein Problem dar.
Das actionreiche Gamplay wird von Savants treibender elektronischer Musik untermalt. Beides ist stellenweise so perfekt aufeinander abgestimmt, dass ich mich an die Rayman-Musiklevel erinnert fühlte. Alles greift so gut ineinander und vereint sich zu einem Spiel, dass man ein extremes Flow-Gefühl elebt.
Hat man den vielleicht etwas kurzen Story Mode beendet, gibt es noch reichlich zu entdecken und die eine oder andere Überraschung.
Savant - Ascent ist einfach ein geniales Spiel und zu dem Preis so gut wie geschenkt.
Eine Absolute Empfehlung!

16042601.review:
Juego de shooter arcade con un ligero toque plataformero donde asumiremos el papel de Savant, un alquimista que se ve expulsado de su propia torre por el poder de un orbe que no logra controlar, su objetivo será volver a subir a lo alto de sus dominios y hacer frente a este poder.

Con unos controles sencillos consistentes en disparar con mecánica “point and click” en 360º y en desplazamientos laterales entre 2 plataformas el juego nos ofrece grandes dosis de acción trepidante con cantidades ingestas de enemigos al frenético ritmo de la música.

El apartado gráfico del título es sobresaliente, escenarios vistosos y bien hechos, personajes con un gran nivel de detalles así como multitud de efectos de sombras y colores que nos maravillan por su fluidez a la par que dinamismo.

El apartado sonoro es digno de mención, pues es ni más ni menos que la obra en versión 8-bit del compositor de dubstep que da título al juego, Savant. El artista noruego en colaboración con los desarrolladores DPad studio nos brindan este magnífico trabajo visual y sonoro que representa una pequeña visión de su mundo artístico en forma de videojuego.

Como pegas poner una duración realmente escasa para el modo historia aunque compensada con varios modos de juego extra y un alto nivel de rejugabilidad gracias a modos como “time attack” y “endless” donde aun no variando en su esencia encontraremos nuevos retos donde exprimir nuestras habilidades al máximo, y todo a un precio bastante justo. Titulo bastante recomendable.

15677624.review:
Savant - Ascent is a sort of twin stick shooter bullet hell type game. You are essentially rooted to two spots on each level, you can roll between them to avoid enemies, jump up and down, and that's it - although this sounds like it is restricting, you soon realize that it's all you need, and you probably don't need an extra thing to think about, so having just two positions is quite a good idea. 

The art style is very nice. A lot of games are taking on this graphic style, and rightfully still as it does look good. The sprites of the main character and all the enemies look awesome too. Now, the music, if you are into electro/dubstep music, you may just have stumbled upon a gold mine. The sound track to Savant is amazing, there are about six different tracks to unlock and each of them is probably one of the best soundtracks you'll ever hear. I am surprised they haven't released the sound track as its own download to be honest! 

Each of the levels is presented very well; the aim is to just kill everything on screen for a number of minutes, nothing too complex. The game does get increasingly difficult though, it will probably take you a few tries on each level before you get to grips with what you have to do. The last two stages probably had me raging more than any other game I've played. That brings me onto game length, the game is very short, I managed to finish the story in just about an hour, while this is short, there are two other game modes that will keep the replayability going. I can see some people have over 100 hours in this game purely from these modes bringing them back for more. 

I would say Savant - Ascent has a place in most people's library, it's short and sweet and for £1, 59, you can't really go wrong can you?

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up. You can also find more reviews over at http://www.completingthebackloggroup.com/

Savant - Ascent
Basically: A game which hones tribute and story from the dubstep group "Savant" in the form of a arcade style shoot-em-up with powerups as you go along with unlockable songs.
Pros:
-Graphics and design look marvelous and have a nice appearance and theme.
-controls are simple and responsive

cons:

-Focus is highly required. there's a lot on the screen at once and some enemies are out of your initial view so you have to look for them.

[u][b]Pros[/b][/u]
- Fantastic soundtrack.
- Fast paced action.
- Retro artwork and sprites are perfect and very well done.
- Tough at first, but a lot of fun once you learn how gameplay works.

[u][b]Cons[/b][/u]
- The game is terribly short, even with additional game modes.


Savant-Ascent is a very fun and face paced quasi-shmup. The retro artwork and sprites are polished to hell and back and look glorious. The music is spot on as well, delivering bass dropping beats as you destroy your enemies. The learning curve in the beginning is a bit high, but after you learn how the game works advancing through the rest of the game is a lot of fun. While the game only has a handful of levels that can be beaten within a few hours, it will be a very fun few hours. I highly recommend this game!

15268051.review:
Well. I have to admit that I have no idea about what I should talk about first. When I bought, for 2$, I never expected it to give me so many hours of fun. I thought it would be a 15 minutes game and that I'd never launch it again after finishing it. Looking at my time in game might inform you of how wrong I was. 

Short version : If you're looking for a 2D shmup with an awesome OST, go for it.

Longer version : I was already a fan of Savant and his other works (as Vinter in Hollywood/Vegas, and his other band names) before knowing the game. When I discovered the game, I didn't think I'd appreciate it so much. First of all, the songs of the OST, which are Savant's work from different albums (Alchemist, Overkill, ISM, Vario, Orakel and Cult), fit perfectly in the nervous gameplay. The difficulty which increases along the levels is here, but it isn't too big, and it permits to have fun even after the twentieth try (gotta admit I ragequited a few times, but that's another story). And when you're finished with the five levels and if you love tryharding and competition, you'll love the Endless and Time Trial mode, which require some patience and skills (and ragequits) to master. Also, the characters from Savant's lore like Vario, the Samurai (spoiler : they are the bosses (spoiler: they're fucking hard at first)) and the Alchemist (the protagonist, who can be seen on Alchemist's album cover) aren't too much (I don't know how to say it, so I'll just assume you got the idea). The only thing that's bad for the game in my opinion are the bugs, but they're funnier than boring and the developer listens to the player and push updates from time to time.

tl;dr savant memes tryhard godlike ost GOTY (got it ?) game 10/10

15053477.review:
As a sucker for musically oriented video games, Savant - Ascent captured my attention from the start.

After booting it up, there's pure silence at the main menu. Odd. Highly out of place. You'd expect some sort of title music in most of your games to give you a sense of what to expect, depending on the overall theme right on entry.

Press Start, and your're treated to - what essentially boils down to - a slide show of stills showing you the story of what has occurred that leads up to your adventure as you "ascend" the tower. Quite literal. While not the most engaging, it's highly effective in its presentation. The lack of animation here is actually something I appreciated. It was out of place, much like the lack of title music, but it gave me all I needed to understand and infer the plot.

Next thing you know, the game begins! 

You're treated to a short tutorial explaining the basic functions: X or Left Trigger to grab CD pieces, Right Stick to shoot your glowies of color, Left Stick to dodge. Simplistic.

The only thing is, you will die. 

If you manage to continue at your base from New Game, I applaud you. But you WILL die. It's actually necessary that you do... If you've been collecting those CD pieces. They act as both your BGM and as your Power Up. 

DUAL FUNCTIONALITY! 

Each CD amounts to four pieces that you get from specific mechanized enemies that give off a yellow/goldish sheen. Take them out, and the piece is yours; you can get up to six CDs, each one adding a different mechanic that is NECESSARY to your progression. 

After death, you begin again at the section that you left off, rather than starting back at the beginning. If you pause, you may choose to restart your section if need be. (FYI: It becomes handy, and almost needed, to begin at the beginning when you get your 5th Power Up and a certain "stone".)

For each CD you collect, you get a different musical style to accompany you. Most of it falls under the general genre of "Dubstep" and "Electro" - two of which I'm familiar with. While I don't like Dubstep too much, it adds to the retro-style look of the game with Chiptune themes and flourishes. The first four CDs are Dubstep, with the fifth being Drum & Bass. The sixth, at the time of writing, remains a mystery, but I hope it will be good!

Overall, after playing nearly two hours non-stop, it has been a great experience. Like I said, I'm a sucker for music games that have certain enemies or gameplay mechanics attached to a beat that require some strategy. This is more akin to a musical SHMUP - being on time doesn't particularly matter, but your mind will automatically sync up to it in some cases, which may hilariously lead to death.

Totally worth playing if you've got nothing else to do, or just feel like rocking out to some sweet jams.

15041509.review:
I've been a fan of Aleksander Vinter for a while now, finding him when he was just staring his debut under his new alias, Savant, and I always had a soft spot for the music he produced. The chiptune-ish, 8-bit feel gave his music a kick that other songs never quite captured, and the overall melody and chord progression of his style was simply unmatched. So, like many, I was caught off guard when I learned that he was creating a game. After purchasing this and playing it for a while (I downloaded it onto my phone thanks to buying through Humble Bundle, and I racked up nearly ten hours alone on my phone version.), I have to say that this game is worth the price tag offered. Maybe even more. Not only do you get to hear several amazing tracks by Vinter, but you also get to experience a gorgeously made game with simplistic, but engaging, game mechanics. The difficulty progresses at a steady, but manageable, rate, and the rewards come easy enough that they would not cause frustration when trying to obtain them while still keeping the feel of difficulty and challenge.
Overall, for what went into the development of it, this game is worth the price tag and worth the time. I'd recommend to anyone who enjoys rail-like shooters with gorgeous graphics or those who enjoy simple, but addicting, games.

14834882.review:
[h1]Музыкальная Алхимия.[/h1]

Довольно крутой инди-экшен с красивым визуальным оформлением. В нём вы играете за Алхимика, эксперимент которого пошёл не так и металл в его башне начал оживать и проявлять агрессивность. Вам нужно эти железяки усмерить, уничтожив поехавшее во время эксперимента ядро, благо у нашего героя есть особая (я бы сказал волшебная) маска, позволяющая стрелять чем-то похожим на ракеты из рук. Игровой уровень состоит из двух платформ, между которыми вы можете маневрировать прыжками или рывками, дабы уворачиваться от наглой домашней утвори. Быстрый гейплей, под довольно хороший саундтрек от некого [b]Savant[/b], который пишет дабстепчик. Собственно игра создана для того чтобы продвинуть его альбом "Alchemist". С саундтреком, кстати, связаны силы главного героя. Собирай кусочки дисков во время игры. Собрал четыре? Получи диск, что даёт тебе саундтрек и новую способность.
Отличное визуальное оформление, хороший саундтрек, интенсивный геймплей. И очень дёшего (для особых скряг даже для такой цены бывают скидки).

[b]Оценка игре по 10-ти бальной шкале: 6/10[/b]

L'univers du jeu indépendant est comme une pochette surprise. On ne sait jamais à l'avance sur quel genre de produit on va tomber tant qu'on ne l'a pas ouvert. Pour l'avoir ouvert, [b] ce jeu est une petite bombe!!! [/b] Développé par DPad studios pour la modique somme de 2€/$, ce jeu m'a donné tout ce que j'espèrais lors de son achat et plus encore.

Je m'explique:
[list]
    [*]Une prise en main facile aussi bien avec un clavier qu'avec une manette
    [*]Un gameplay dynamique qui va vous rendre accro' tellement la sensation est joussif
    [*]La musique... Que dire de la musique, composé par Ascent, elle accompagne le jeu avec perfection. Plus besoin de rechercher une playlist avant de lancer un jeu. Un melange de dubstep-electro-drum&bass pour rendre vos parties endiablées servi sur un plateau.
    [*]Un système d'amélioration pour renforcer votre arsenal (via la collecte "d'objectif")
    [*]Un système de ladder pour mesurer votre capacité à celle de vos amis et au reste du monde
    [*]Et bien sur des achèvements à débloquer qui seront pour certain d'entre eux un véritable défi à débloquer <3
    [*]Un style 2D de pixel-art très soigné qui fera plaisir aux grands comme aux petits
[/list]

On incarne une version stylée/badass d'un " [url=https://www.google.ca/search?q=guy+fawkes+mask&espv=2&biw=944&bih=967&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ei=iL_LVJnVMMmvggSIsYKgCw&sqi=2&ved=0CAYQ_AUoAQ] Guy Fawkes Mask [/url] "qui va devoir affronter une légion d'ennemis pour reprendre sa place au sommet de la tour. Simple et efficace. On vient de vous donner une raison de réduire à néant une dizaine de centaine de millier ennemis. Allez-y, cliquez sur ce bouton d'achat! Vous attendez une invitation? Bah voilà, je vous invite à l'acheter les yeux fermés.

14195458.review:
Okay, how have I never heard of this?!?!?  Why do only two of my friends have it?!?!?  This is $1.99?!?!?  Is that even legal?!?!?!

In all seriousness though this game, oh man.  I had about 3 bucks left over in my steam account from the 2014 Winter Sale.  I was browsing the cheapest games.  Most everything was trash, but this caught me eye.  I saw the reviews were good and the soundtrack was cool.  I'm a sucker for soundtracks so I went ahead and got it.  I installed it and loaded it up.  About 10 minutes in I was having some fun, the beats were sweet and the controls were tight.  Then I got to the second level which upped the difficulty and I was getting into it.  Then I unlocked the next soundtrack.  I was listening with my crappy laptop speakers but then I put my headphones on.  It was like a barrage of beats penetrating my ears.  It was pure euphoria.  The game apparently at launch was only 3 levels but now there are two more, an endless mode, and insane upgrades.  Hands down the best $1.99 I ever spent.  When I played the endless mode I was hooked.  The night I got it I played for 2 hours straight.  That is really rare for me.  What are you waiting for?  Honestly, what else are you going to spend $1.99 on?  ;)

14133494.review:
The camera is your worst enemy in this game. Shoot low, camera ducks low, pack comes in from the top - every time. I'm a somewhat old school gamer, and I'm no stranger to NES-level difficulty. This one, however, starts out a bit difficult and by stage two I wanted to turn it off.

There are also visual bugs, specifically in the menus. Bits and pieces of something kept popping in all over the screen while I tried to figure out how to get the game to function with a Logitech controller - which it won't, by the way. That said, you won't really need a controller for Savant, it's played mostly with the mouse, which is not in itself a bad thing.

Another minor problem is that I none of the resolutions on offer fit my screen, all of them leaving part of the screen behind my taskbar. One of them changed the position of the window, placing the top of the window above the screen, making me unable to drag the window until I changed the resolution yet again. There is no full-screen or windowed full screen option.

And the music is unremarkable. By no means is it bad, but not nearly attention-grabbing enough to justify it being a central facet of the game.

Absolutely beautiful pixel art, though. Too bad I can't review it separately.

14128374.review:
Savant-Ascent

	J'aime pas les jeux dur, enfin si, mais pas les jeux trop dur. C'est désagréable de perdre tout le temps, de mourir à répétitions, de ce retaper le même niveau cinquante heures durant. C'est pour cela que j'aime la musique, sa me détend. Je vois la vie différemment, sous un autre angle, généralement plus positif que le précédent. Mais la musique me donne aussi du courage, tel un chant tribal avant la bataille, ou un verre de whisky avant la demande en mariage. Dans tout les cas  la musique joue sur mes sentiments, mes émotions.La musique mais pas que, les jeux-vidéos aussi. Oui, me direz-vous, mais lesquelles ? Et bien un en particulier. J'ai ressenti de l'admiration envers ce jeu, de la haine, du soulagement, de la colère, de la satisfaction, j’eus même ri quelques fois. Mais au final je ne peux lui en vouloir.

	Vous ne voyez toujours pas de quelle jeu je veux parlé ? Savant-Ascent. Un Shoot'em up-like. Développer par DPad studios et paru le 4 décembre 2013, ce petit jeu à fait un bon bout de chemin et à pas mal gagner en maturité grâce à ces nombreux patchs. Il possède tout ce qu'un Schump doit avoir : Une certaine difficulté mais des contrôles simples et bien rodés, des ennemis occupant 90 % de votre écran du fait de leur nombres, et enfin des boss. 
	Jusque là, rien a redire sur S-A mais plutôt à rajouter. Certes,  la prise en main et simple et intuitive (3 actions de base : sauter, aller a gauche, aller à droite ; plus 1 action débloquée plus tard qui consiste a charger son énergie en appuyant sur « s ») mais la difficulté est présente et ce immédiatement. Ce n'est pas le gameplay la difficulté, vu qu'il ne consiste qu'à tirer sur des mobs pour les occire et à ramasser des morceaux de CD d'or. Nan, la difficulté ce situe sur la capacité à interpréter les informations que le jeu nous envoie, et à s'en servir à bonne escient. Le nombre d'ennemis ne faisant qu'augmenter cette difficulté.

	Je vous parlez de ramasser des morceaux de CD d'or, et si vous êtes un peu curieux, vous devez vous demander ce que cela a à voir avec ce jeu. Le lien est d'une simplicité et d'une logique à toute épreuve : Lorsque l'on ramasse un fragment on gagne un peu d'énergie (nécessaire à l'envoi de sort plus puissant), une fois arrivé a 4 fragment on recréer un CD d'or. Celui-ci nous débloque de nouvelle compétence mais aussi de nouveaux soundtracks. C'est ici que le jeu dévoile toute sont inventivité. Je veux dire, Savant-Ascent n'a pas réinventer son genre, mais il y a ajouter sa touche personnelle. Débloquer des compétence en même temps que de somptueux soundtracks, que l'on choisit à chaque mort ce qui permet de ne jamais avoir la même musique, et vraiment une bonne idée. C'est bête mais fallait y penser n'est ce pas ?

	Je ne vous est pas tout dévoiler de ce jeu. J'ai même essayer de vous fournir une approche très épurée de celui-ci. J'aurais pu vous parler de ces graphismes correct, voir même bon, ou j'aurai pu approfondir l'approche de son gameplay bien penser, simple et fun à jouer. Mais non, je veux que vous soyez curieux, que vous allez chercher par vous même directement dans le jeu, achetez le. Il en vaut le coup, de plus il n'est pas cher. Ce serait une erreur que de rater une occasion de l'acheter. Et comme disait Jonathan Swift : « Les hommes ont si peu d'occasions d'être heureux qu'ils n'en doivent perdre aucune. »

14036293.review:
[i]That fucking Camera![/i]

Savant - Ascent is an attempt to mesh an awesome series of soundtracks with arcade twin stick shooter action! so what could go wrong? 
Except the camera, not a lot actually because the game is pretty rad.
But the camera, that fucking camera, ruins everything.
You see in Savant you don't move in the traditional sense. Rather like a "game and watch" you are fixed on screen with only 3 options, dodge left or right or jump. Baddies charge at you and you need to get out the way; this gets tricker as the game goes on and is great stuff.

This all falls apart due to one fatal flaw which is the moving camera, you see the camera moves in the direction you are shooting in so you are blind sided from every direction except the one you are shooting. To make matters worse, moving prevents shooting, so you can't just hop around to avoid getting hit otherwise too many enemies will appear and you will die.

Everything about the game is either good or great. The art direction the various soundtracks (yes you can pick different soundtracks as you play!) the controls (although admittedly they are limited and simple) are good but the whole challenge of the game is dodging enemy attacks or enemies altogether so its a huge, huge promblem that you can hardly see where the enemies are coming from in order to dodge them.

It's a handicap that ruins what is otherwise an amazing gaming experience and while progress in the game will unlock ways to help deal with this, it is clear it was a design intention but sadly a misguided one because games like Contra are hard; like Metal Slug are challenging but those are great games! No will look down on you for copying the tried and tested method of making a run and gun game! 

If you can deal with the camera moving around all the time then you will enjoy the game but for me I really really tried hard and everytime I got into the game I just couldn't look past how much better the game would be, without giving me motion sickness. :(

13951642.review: SAVANT Ascent is perhaps one of the most worthwhile purchases on steam I have made during my time on this platform. For the very low price of 1.99, this game provides an endless arcade mode and leaderboards, along with incredible art and satisfying animation, and a challenging campaign. In addition to visuals, this game has controls that new players can pick up in a matter of seconds. As for the music, this game is based off of the electronic dance music producer, Savant, so the entire soundtrack is looped versions of songs from ISM, Love, and others. Even if you don't like the EDM scene, this game really feels like it packs a punch, and is definitely worth a try if you're into constant action.

Il gameplay è semplice: distruggere tutti i nemici che vi appaiono attorno. Lo si può fare mirando col mouse e spostarsi con la tastiera, ma personalmente preferisco le levette del buon caro controller.
Il gioco al momento è composto da 5 livelli, 7 potenziamenti "soundtracks" che si potranno sbloccare durante le partite e rimarranno attive in modo permanente e 3 modalità di gioco.

Detto questo, è un gioco che sa tenere testa anche ai giocatori "hardcore" proponendo sfide impegnative che metteranno alla prova i loro riflessi e ritmo, grazie alla freneticità che aumenta esponenzialmente con l'avanzare dei livelli.
L'unico rimpianto è che dura decisamente poco, secondo me.

Reccomending this game because it costs next to nothing and was enjoyable for 2hours.
Big problem is toward the end; in the two last levels the game ups the difficulty level by the most boring way you know in an arcade-style shooter: give monsters more hp than your damage output lets you clear. For example, to charge your meter fast enough you have to hold down, while jumping from platform to platform. Sometimes he opts to just jump straight up and land on the same platform, other times he choose to jump from one platform to the next. And, you have no invincibility or anything while in air so it just feels completely random whether you can dodge or not. 
Was enjoyable until last two stages, after that just frustrating and boring.

13801684.review:
If I had gotten this game at launch, I'd be mad. I'm just disappointed, and where to start.

Well, it's a one-stick shooter. The store description makes Savant sound agile and mobile. You CANNOT walk, and only jump between 2 platforms on screen. Oh, but it's a game about climbing the tower? That involves one screen of fighting enemies until the elevator starts moving, a second screen as the elevator flies to the top, and a third screen with the boss fight ending. An update did add 2 more sections, but they don't change much. The core game can be easily beaten in 10 minutes, with some time attacks under 2 minutes.

Gameplay is simple, jump and shoot. There are some extra mechanics with the first shot, charge shots, and grapples, but they are unlocked by beating the game. So the early parts are only difficult or time-consuming because you have no damage or abilities unlocked. Once you collect everything, the game becomes trivial enough that you hardly need to jump to avoid damage. There are only 5 enemy types, and combat switches between bullet-spongy grinds to easy mode once you unlock the last CD.

Oh yea, the music is a thing. It's not what I expected from the store video. I like maybe 2 of the 7 tracks, but they are all short enough that they loop and repeat. Music tracks only switch when you pause the game to select a new one, unless the game decides to switch to the Wyrm spawn song. I know the game is absurdly short, but the soundtrack should at least vary enough to last the length. Some people argue the cost is worth for the songs alone, but there is so much free music available now from generous artists, I can't recommend this game's music unless you already like the specific artists. If you are a chiptune-dubstep fan, you can probably find free songs from other artists.

There may be more content coming, but at this point I have to consider the game effectively complete. The Void update nearly doubled the game content, which is nice, but I'd think there should've been some big Early Access banners for how short and incomplete the game was. Simple bugs still remain, navigating too far in the music selection will crash the game. 

The graphics are amazing and I love the style, but the game just stumbles too much to end so soon. It feels like a demo, and only gains depth once the game is nearly finished. That leaves score attack content as the only reason to replay, but I expected a complete game. I suppose it was a fair deal at 50% off, completing everything in 4 hours. I still feel misled, as the store neglected to point out that walking around was not a feature. It feels like a Newgrounds game with excellent art, but I can't recommend unless you know what you are getting here.

13708001.review:
TL;DR: Dubstep sorcery with robotics Mega-Man style.  Expect a challenge.

Rest of the review:

This is a very simple game with a lot of charm.  The dubstep music is very welcoming and is easily the star of the show, but the gameplay is very well planned out as well.  At first, the dodging system feels a little too limited, but the dodging became far more useful as the game progressed.  Shooting things, while initially fun, seemed like it was going to become repetitive.  Boss battles, however, are extremely challenging, and you constantly have to experiment with strategies to figure out how to win each battle.

The challenge is the biggest hurdle.  The game gives you very little get-to-know-the-game time before throwing challenges at you, but as you unlock CDs, you also unlock abilities which make the game a little more bearable.  I found myself rage-quitting at the third big swarm battle because I not only had to protect myself but I also had to protect my platforms, which were honestly not very easy to protect, even with the dodge-to-regain-power ability.  If you don't want a challenge, don't get this game!

Une petite dédicace à Savant un très bon artiste dubstep et ça se voit, vous jouerez sur un excellent Shoot'em up qui travaillera vos réfléxes en vous obligeant à regarder aux quatres coins de l'écran. Par ailleurs, ce jeu met en scène un système de skill en dévérouillant des disques qui s'obtiennent en ramassant quatres fragments de disques à l'aide d'un grapin. Leurs effets sont variés et vous permette également de changer la musique de fond durant cette bataille épique. Un petit jeu certes, mais très addictif, vous aurez souvent envie d'y rejouer soit pour réécouter les soundtracks (pour les fans de dubstep) ou bien essayer de tryhard pour améliorer son score et finir en tête du leaderboard.
Il y a évidemment d'autres modes de jeu disponible sur le jeu pour augmenter la difficulté et varier ainsi les games : comme le mode Time Attack ou Endless.
Bref je pense que tout est dis, ce jeu est merveilleux pour les oreilles et pour les gens qui attendent un Shoot'em up pas comme les autres, j'approuve ! :D

*UPDATE*
I recently picked up this game again just to see if my skills had matured. Sure enough, they have and my opinion of the game has changed slightly. I would still only recommend this game to the hardcore gamers, but after figuring out that you can unlock new attacks and skills through collecting golden disks, gameplay got a little easier. But the game never really explains this unless you actually read the description of the disks after you unlock them, which I hadn't done before. Getting one disk in particular (disk 6) is a nightmare for me though because it requires you to play the game's "endless" mode and survive past wave 4 which might sound simple but is truely a test of skill to behold. This is where the game turns into controller breaking frustration as your progess is pretty much halted if you can't get this one disk to acheive the true ending to the game. At $2.99 current price, I'd say pick it up just for the experience at least.

Old Review:
Personally It's not my cup of tea. It's got vibrant animation, great sound track and crisp, clear graphics. It's a fast paced shooter with plenty of thrills and kills to go around. For many people who love bullet hells, you might just like this one. Me on the otherhand feel that the difficulty of this game can rival that of Darksouls, and unfortunately that's a turn off for me. The game is meant to be difficult of course and I'm not faulting it for that, but there are times where there is absolutely nothing you can do to prevent an innevitable death as the enemies clutter up the screen faster than you can shoot them down, and your only means of dodging are jumping between 2 platforms in an effort to get out of the enemy's line of attack. That lack of free-movment unfortunately it was turns me off. It's a nice music based game, but unfortunately I would only recommend it to hardcore gamers.

13557893.review:
Hablar de la figura de Savant a muchos les resultará nuevo. Tras este nombre se esconde Aleksander Vinter, un productor noruego de música electronica que sufre del "Síndrome de Savant", el cual se define como un transtorno derivado del autismo que confiere a quienes lo sufren capacidades anormalmente amplias en campos como el arte, el cálculo, la memoria y la capacidad cerebral. Aprovechándose de su transtorno, Aleksander se ha convertido en pocos años en un autor inquietantemente prolífico, de talento desmesurado, y ante todo, extraño; el cual aliado con un tímido pero poderoso D-Pad Studio, nos trae un divertido videojuego con un impresionante apartado artístico y una esencia difícil de encontrar en otros símiles.

La trama en sí, no representa mucha complejidad. Expuesta tan solo mediante una breve cinemática de introducción al comienzo del juego en la cual se deja ver como Savant, convertido en una especie de alter-ego inspirado en los villanos más típicos del mundillo (el cual también "encarna" en sus canciones), se cae de lo más alto de una torre debido a su contacto fallido con una extraña esfera de energía. El concepto de nuestro objetivo, de nuevo se presenta de forma simple: debemos subir de nuevo al piso más alto para controlar esa energía desatada.

La sencillez, en este caso es una virtud clara. Si bien los creadores pudieron haberse extendido más dando explicaciones sobre el lore creado por Savant, o simplemente extender esta rama que nos concierne,  ajustaron sus movimientos para crear una historia corta y nada barroca que sin embargo sintetiza en una aventura fresca y eficaz. Es así como, hábilmente, se crea un videojuego equilibrado que nos oferta oleadas de diversión sin exceder demasiado en sus capacidades, dándonos los justo y nada más. Se agradece a la par el nivel de dificultad, ciertamente elevado, el cual nos concede un desafío más duro; además de la forma de solventar la corta amplitud vital del título con diferentes modos de juego y una buena capacidad rejugable.

El apartado jugable también peca de sencillo, pero quizá no congenia tan bien como lo hace la trama. Básicamente, el juego nos sitúa entre dos plataformas estáticas, situadas una a cada lado de la pantalla, siendo nuestro único escenario. Solo podremos movernos entre esas dos, bien rodando, bien saltando, para esquivar a los enemigos y disparar a todo lo que nos parezca amenazador en un ángulo de 360º. Es un hecho, además, la ausencia prácticamente total de lo que tildaríamos de errores o 'bugs', compensando esta simpleza; además de contar con un hábil sistema de poderes desbloqueables bien equilibrado; y con un ritmo frenético y astuto que nos hará ansiar la mayor puntuación posible en cada una de nuestras partidas. 

En lo tocante al tema visual, estamos ante uno de los puntos fuertes del producto. Los artistas de D-Pad Studio muestran una habilidad y un talento asombroso a la hora de dibujar, como podemos ver en el prometedor e inacabado proyecto de la misma casa, "Owlboy". Cada apartado, desde el personaje protagonista hasta los enemigos, pasando por unos cuidados efectos visuales, muestran una dedicación a cuerpo y alma desmesurada en calidad de píxeles. Además de estar tan bien concepcionados, el hecho de que se muestren tan sincronizados con el ambiente creado por la soberbia intervención musical y la dinámica del juego, aportan bagaje a lo que no deja de ser un producto extraordinario. Todas esas tonalidades oscuras, la calidad gráfica de los entornos, y lo adecuado de sus efectos, nos hacen una grata aproximación a lo que sería la visión del músico de su propio mundo imaginario y artístico.

Hablando de temas fuertes: la música. Si el juego, basado en la figura de un músico de la figura de Savant pecase de mediocre, no estaría escribiendo este análisis. Es un hecho que el comprador, fan o no del compositor, espera una impecable caricia a sus oídos, cosa que se cumple con creces en este nuestro analizado. Con varias de las canciones del joven introducidas directamente en los escenarios (dándonos la posibilidad incluso de elegir entre ellas) nos deleitaremos en cada disparo con las obras de este genio musical. Si a esto le añadimos un buen puñado de efectos de sonido muy adecuados al estilo de música de Savant y que además acompasan a la perfección con el resto de apartados, tenemos la perfecta combinación. Quizá, es cierto, una opción acertada hubiera sido la de ensanchar la cantidad de canciones dentro del juego, ya que se pueden volver repetitivas para nuestra audición tras varias horas de juego si no somos acérrimos seguidores del autor.

En resumen, estamos ante un producto muy notable, con una gran calidad dentro del apartado audiovisual y una astuta organización jugable que nos hará divertirnos un buen rato machacando botones. Si eres un fan del músico, es claramente un producto que debes comprar; si no, es un buen comienzo para llegar a conocer su vasta obra. Una pena que se disfrute en pocas horas y que la presencia del músico en el desarrollo del juego no se haga tan patente como debiera.

13549061.review:
Savant - Ascent has to have been my best 79 pence I have spent all year. As a fan of Dubstep and the man himself since he released ISM, its amazing to see him rise to prominence, even if it includes a video game.

The simplicity of the game bedazzles me, basically its an Arcade/Action style shooter, where you fend off hoards of enemies whilst on either two available platforms, or an elevator of some kind. Facing off against these enemies can sometimes be a challenge especially for me, especially on the Time Attack and Endless game modes this game offers. Some enemies in this game will offer CD pieces when destroyed, and can be collected to form full CD's that offer 1. Sweet music from Savant's previous albums and 2. Exclusive powers to give you an advantage during play.

The game offers limited controls, Left, Right, Mouse Control for aim and Space for Jumping. This makes it a simple game to play for anyone who wishes to reminisce over old arcade shooters. Like myself.

The music you collect through CD's can be selected at will, they are offered as Savant's old songs from his previous albums, they are Ascent, Bach To The Phuture from the Ninur album, ISM from the ISM album, Kali 47 and Butterfly from the Cult album, Fat Cat Shuffle and Melody Circus from the Alchemist album, Organismical from his recent Orakel album and Vario 64 from his Overkill Album.

Overall, I love this game not because I am a fan of Savant, but because this sort of game is so challenging it makes me want to bash my computer in with a Sledgehammer (No pun intended)

- 9/10 - Great gameplay, simplistic, adrenaline pumping music and not enough Manslaughter (No pun intended)

13245571.review:
Savant - Ascent may have a killer soundtrack, but that's not the only good thing about it.

This game is a simple 2D shoot-'em-up, played mainly with the mouse. Savant, your character, is stationed at the center of the screen, on one of two platforms, and your goal is to survive the hordes of enemies around you. You can "dodge" by quickly switching platforms, which will keep you alive much longer if used correctly. Power-ups, unlocked by collecting CD pieces dropped by certain enemies, make the the game a little more interesting, and the levels get more difficult, but the basic gameplay remains the same.

It's fun blasting away enemies, having to decide which enemies to target, how best to use your abilities to defeat them. But the pixel graphics and the amazing soundtrack by Savant (no, that's not a coincidence) aren't enough to conceal the repetitiveness of the gameplay. This game is more of a score attack than a constantly evolving experience, since most of the replay value comes from attempting to beat previous scores. That having been said, it's probably a good thing that the game is short, otherwise it would drag out and lose its entertainment value, which it currently has a lot of.

[u][b]Pros[/b][/u]
[list]
[*]Shooting up hordes is fun
[*]Power-ups and dodging mechanics make the game interesting
[*]Absolutely stunning soundtrack
[/list]

[u][b]Cons[/b][/u]
[list]
[*]Panning around the screen feels clunky at times
[*]Gameplay is somewhat repetitive
(Note: I wouldn't say being a short game is a con in this case, for reasons stated above, and the price tag)
[/list]

[b]TL;DR:[/b] Savant - Ascent is definitely short, but it's awesome, and I'd say the low price tag was worth it.

13234994.review: Definitely the best $2 I've spent in a long while. I'd say the game's certainly worth much more than a hotdog. The game plays like a great and innovative frantic shooter with plenty of never before seen elements, and the amazing (customizeable!) soundtrack adds a LOT to the intense feel. There's even a rhythm-based final boss, and I've always had a weakness for a good rhythm-based shooter. Also included are time attack and endless modes. The only tiny downside is that it seems difficult to control whether the character jumps straight up in the air or to the other platform at times. 9.5/10; I really hope to see more updates in the future.

13154575.review: At first I was surprised by the simplicity of moving the character.  The only places he can be at is to a left and right position.  There is no walking on platforms.  But despite this straightforwardness, the game is insanely fun.  You control a Savant who not only can output a barrage of damage to wipe out enemies but also quickly evade enemy attacks by switching positions by either jumping or rolling.  It's fairly hard at first but as you collect these in-game objects that are CD pieces and complete them to become full CD's, you unlock powers that makes the Savant stronger, such as shooting missiles after rolling.  Not only that but completing each CD unlocks a new soundtrack to listen to and every soundtrack is awesome and matches the hectic pace of the game.  It's a fairly short game but considering the price and replayability, it's very well worth it.  If there was any wish I had about the game, it would be for the developers to sell the soundtrack as well.

12811759.review:
This game was quite enjoyable to play.  I had no idea what I was stepping into (like most games I get from humble bundles), but I actually really liked it.  You need to focus during this game.  Sure, it looks like a small time indie game, but you need to be fast and quick minded when playing Savant.  

You basically are being attacked from all directions.  You have infinite bullets, and can only occupy two positions.  When getting to the opposite position you can either slide to it or jump to it (basically your dodge ability).  As you kill more enemies, they drop quarters of discs that unlock both new music and new powers.  Once you are dead, you restart from the level you started at on that playthrough, but when you die, all the discs you collected are formed together to create your powers and music.

I was hesitant to recommend this game at first, but it eventually stood up to it's name.  It's fun and worth the buy.  If you're looking for some simple, witty action, then this is your game.  Enjoy your unlimited ammo!

12811578.review:
I haven't put a lot of time into the game yet, but I can tell that this is one of those titles that you will instantly love or hate, and what side of the fence you're on will likely be for the same reasons. 

Savant - Ascent is a twin-stick shooter (or WASD and mouse shooter depending on your control scheme)  whereby a Guy Fawkes-ish looking guy with a sweet hat and cape ascends back to the top of his tower to regain his full magical power.

The game's design is fairly polarizing. There are a couple of things worth noting before making that steep, steep investment of $2. 

Wub Wub Wub
If you like dubstep, you will love the soundtrack. An integral part of the game is collecting pieces of CDs that simultaneously expands your powers while expanding your listening options. 

If dubstep really isn't your thing, this game won't change your mind. You may be inclided to mute the sound and listen to your own music instead.

You Will Die - A LOT. 
At the start of each game, you are allowed to be hit three times before you die. The game saves your progress each time you ascend to the next level, and will start there each time you pick the game back up. Your survival along the way will rely on your ability to dodge and shoot at the same time. The game's fast speed and high degree of difficultly are what make it engaging.  Whether you rise to the challenge or rage quit will depend on your tolerance for it. In fact, a good portion of the game's difficulty arises from the next point.

Tight Camera Focus
This is the only pure negative I have about the game. The focus of the camera is zoomed in on the character, leaving your surroundings unseen. Your first dozen or so deaths will likely result from the fact that when enemies appear, you aren't even aware of their existence until they attack. This is clearly by design as one of the powers you get will grant you more insight as to when and where they appear by way of flashing the screen and red arrow indicators. It is helpful, but I would much rather have a zoomed out view so I can see everything that's going on.

When you shoot, the camera shifts in that direction. When you release, the camera shifts back to the character. If you are attacked from behind while shooting, you won't even know what hit you. WIth this camera shift also comes another, external, hazard. If you are prone to motion sickness, this game will turn your stomach upside-down. It did me. Within minutes, the constant camera shifts might have you clicking the X and grab some ginger root. 


If none of the above bothers you, the asking price is an enormous value for a game that lends itself to so much replay and fast, engaging action. Though, how much you like it may depend on your preference for dubstep, tolerance for frequent death, and your ability to keep nausea in check.

12691073.review:
Este juego es espectacular, especialmente desde la nueva actualización.

Para explicarlo sencillamente, es un bullet hell donde tu movimiento esta restringido a dos plataformas en todo momento. Podés pasar de una plataforma a la otra en linea recta o saltando.
Al principio empezas con pocos poderes, pero al ir recogiendo los trozos de CDs en los niveles, vas destrabando habilidades del personaje.

El tema del movimiento parece restrictivo al principio y tal vez decepcione, pero la verdad no me lo imagino de otra manera ahora. Se usan pocas teclas para el movimiento, pero le agrega un nivel de complejidad muy interesante, y planificar tus movimientos en base a los enemigos se vuelve muy divertido.

Otra razón por la cual es muy recomendable es por la musica, y en mi opinión, la estetica, los escenarios son variados e interesantes.

Termino con un comentario, los desarrolladores parecen buena gente, y prestaron atención a los reclamos de los foros y arreglaron un monton de cosas con el ultimo update, además de agregar contenido totalmente gratis. Me pareció algo destacable :D

12666048.review:
[h1] Музыкальная Алхимия [/h1]
Довольно крутой инди-экшен с красивым визуальным оформлением. В нём вы играете за Алхимика, эксперимент которого пошёл не так и металл в его башне начал оживать и проявлять агрессивность. Вам нужно эти железяки усмерить, уничтожив взбесившееся во время эксперимента ядро, благо у нашего героя есть особая (я бы сказал волшебная) маска, позволяющая стрелять из рук чем-то похожим на ракеты. Игровой уровень состоит из двух платформ, между которыми вы можете перемещаться прыжками или рывками, дабы уворачиваться от наглой домашней утвори. Быстрый гейплей, под довольно клёвый саундтрек от некого Savant, который пишет дабстепчик. Собственно игра создана для того чтобы продвинуть его альбом "Alchemist". С саундтреком, кстати, связаны силы главного героя. Собирай кусочки дисков во время игры. Собрал четыре? Получи диск, что даёт тебе ещё один трек и новую способность.
Отличное визуальное оформление, хороший саундтрек, интенсивный геймплей. И очень дёшего (для особых скряг даже для такой цены бывают скидки). Рекомендую.

P.S. Недавно вышло обновление. Добавили нового босса, довольно сложного. Ну и конечно саундтрек.

Pros:
Great graphics.  Great music.  Addictive.  Even has some slightly hidden references to other popular games. 

Cons:
Extremely extremely short story mode.  Beat it twice in an hour or 2 of playing, not counting the time attack and endless modes.  Left me wishing for a much bigger tower!  Also, it's not a true platformer like the videos may accidentally make it look like.  You tell your character when to jump or dodge, and that consists the entirety of your movement.  Only a con if you're under the assumption it's a platformer like I was.
--
I got my copy in a Humble Bundle.  But if I hadn't, it'd probably be worth the 2 bucks they're currently asking for IMO.
Awesome little game.

All in all for $1.99 this game is damn well worth it

12290239.review:
[b]Dubstep, равно как и Drum'n base стремительно влились в повседневность, соответствуя актуальным тенденциям свежих взглядов на мир.[/b] 
Естественно, чувствительный к модернизациям игрострой своевременно среагировал - без того качественный уровень акустической составляющей вновь поднят на новую высоту.

Некто Александр Винтер в 2009 году решил окунуться в дабстеп создав музыкальный проект [url=http://ololo.fm/artist/biography/Savant]Savant[/url]. Скорее в целях рекламы, а может нет, Ascent создавалась как наглядность образа [url=http://www.savantofficial.com]Savant'а[/url], но в любом случае стала знаменательной.
[url=https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D1%E8%ED%E4%F0%EE%EC_%F1%E0%E2%E0%ED%F2%E0]Савантизм[/url], как известно, явление очень и очень редкое, а привлечение внимания к себе столь громким ярлыком, казалось бы, нецелесообразно с позиции доверия. Как бы то ни было, ознакомившись с композициями привлекшими мое внимание тут, я проникся "алхимией", [url=http://www.dpadstudio.com/]D-pad studio[/url] постарались на совесть.

Отстреливая многочисленных роботов-чайников (и не только), подбирая осколки пластинок мы открываем дорожки разных временных этапов проекта Савант, кои мы в праве выбирать впоследствии фоновыми, с оглядкой на наши предпочтения. Приятное ощущение мистицизма, проработанности стиля... Динамичные треки хаотично-устроенного ритма этап от этапа определяют темп простого, гениально, геймплея, услаждая слух геймера. Визуальный ряд порождает в голове невообразимый доселе вариант мировосприятия.

[b]Что до целевой аудитории, пожалуй, советую ознакомиться всем любознательным людям, но особенно тем, кто ощущает потребность в беспрерывном поиске "оригинальностей" среди инди-игр. Весьма скромная продолжительность, но, как альтернатива, реиграбельность, не оставляют и тени сомнения в  "высокой номинальной стоимости" игры.[/b]

12143478.review:
[b] 4/5. GREAT GAME ! [/b]

[h1] OVERALL [/h1]
This game is pure awesomeness, I've been a fan from the electro house DJ from a couple of years now and when I found out that he had a game I had to play it and boy I wasn't letted down. This action game is a shoot 'em up that needs a lot of coordination if you want to progress, also as you collect Golden CDs you unlock new songs to play in the background and Savant is an exquisite electro house DJ, for $2 you can't go wrong!

[h1] REPLAYABILITY [/h1]
You may beat this game in 2 or 3 hours, but once you get to the end boss you can still fight your way to collect 2 more Golden CDs, which mean 2 more songs and 2 more abilities, I haven't been able to get the 6th and last Golden CD and that frustrates me... but things get pretty hectic in Endless Mode and I have just been able to get the 5th GCD, the last one is way too hard! 
  
[h1] GAMEPLAY [/h1]
The gameplay has a nice difficulty curve, even if you keep dying you will be accumulating golden CD pieces and once you get 4 you unlock a new song and new abilities that will help you a lot to progress, creeps that were given you a tough time will be vaporized in a breeze after getting the 4th Golden CD, you may also learn to evade hits more efficiently, overall it's easy to just use your Mouse on one hand and a few keys on the other, the only complaint will be the lack of variety in the levels, you only have The 1st Floor, The Elevator Climb and The Boss Stage.

[h1] AESTHETIC [/h1]
I love this game look, it's a great realization on Savant's previous cover art for its albums and singles, plus it captures this magic atmosphere that was very well transmitted in his songs, specially on the album titled "Alchemist", we get "Melody Circus" from that album as the 5th track you may unlock.

[h1] STORY [/h1]
The story is simple and yet very cool, specially on the Boss Stage when you'll fight some unexpectedly familiar foe. You play as Savant, a alchemist who tries to control the mysterious great power of the Philosopher’s Stone and fails, getting blasted by an explosion who throws you out of the tower of your castle and you need to climb back and try to master this bizarre energy.

[h1] MUSIC [/h1]
Do I need to tell anything more? I'm clearly a big fan of electronic dance music, and electro house is a pretty energetic genre that nourish amazingly well this videogame, it was love at first play.

12117686.review:
This is a great arcade style game with original gameplay which is very surprising since most arcade games that come out nowadays are a remake of  something or a new version of something else, very detailed animations with great aesthetics and amazing music.

It's a mixture of a run and gun shoot em up (Metal Slug) and a arena shoot em up (Geometry Wars) where you are locked to 3 directions (Left, Up, Right) and you shoot enemies from every angle while trying to not get hit by them to build up your score (And not die since you can only get hit 3 times) with some small but very interesting twists from the enemies and the enviroment.

Absolutely recommended for someone looking for a simple game to chill and be satisfied with for short periods of time, there's a lot of replayability if you care about the unlockables (Music tracks/Powerups) or high scores.

12008912.review:
Ignore my playtime. I have sunk several hours into this game outside of Steam.

Have you ever played an awful game that just completely captured you with a stellar soundtrack? Well replace that bad game with something of epically fun proportions and you will get Savant Ascent. When you first crank this bad boy up, I implore you to have a good set of headphones ready to rock. The music will melt your face off with its genuinely heart pounding syncopation of the blisteringly fast gameplay. This game is not for the faint of heart. I come from a background of solid training in the SHMUP (shoot em' up) genre, yet I still found a pretty good challenge in my first few playthroughs. 

The core of Savant Ascent's gameplay is built around dodging waves of enemies and blasting them with rapid shots at the same time. You are also tasked with collecting various CD pieces that will drop from specific enemies. These pieces are extremely valuable as they will unlock new soundtracks to compliment your destructive rampage, as well as give you new abilities for your character. Things like charge shots, a spray of missiles, and alerts when encroaching enemies are coming towards you. Speaking of enemies, there are only a few types. Each of them are very discernable from one another, an attention to detail that I greatly appreciated. Some will simply slowly move towards you. Other's are much more menacing as they require several shots to take down and will lunge at you at high speeds. They game is not afraid to throw multiple types of baddies at you to induce panic. 

Controls are very simple. Three keys are used for dodging or jumping left or right to the only 2 predetermined spots you can occupy. the mouse is used to move a cursor around, and you simply click and hold the left button to unleash a steady stream of magical bolts. 

The game has only three modes to choose from. Story, Time Attack, and Endless. Endless is by far my favorite and it is truly what the game was built to provide it's players. However, I would very much recommend that all players start with story mode. 

Savant's story mode starts with a scene very reminiscent of Castlevania Symphony of The Night. A gothic castle-esque interior painted with deep intense variations of purples, blues, and greys. Suddenly, our pixel perfect hero comes smashing through a glass window in all of his glory. He looks like if V, from "V for Vendetta", had a love child with a Sith lord. Get ready for about 30 seconds of hand holding before the game completely dumps you into the shark tank. You will die relatively fast on your first attempt. I lasted about a minute, as I recall, before meeting my untimely demise. This is just one of those video games experiences that abuses you in a good way. It says "Hey stupid! wake up and pay the hell attention to what is going on around you!". I seriously felt like I was learning the basics of gaming all over again. I was punished with a gameover screen and my score tally counted up. Then something awesome happened. I watched as all the cd parts I had managed to collect formed into a new disk. The music instantly changed into another heart pumping rhythm and offered to throw me right back into the fray with a new ability. The sense of defeat was met with a small form of progress that many games these days seem to neglect. I didn't even have time to take a bite of the big fat failure cake I had just made myself before I spawned back at my last check point. The story mode itself is very short. Only three stages long with the last being a pretty fun, yet intense, boss fight. I won't spoil the surprise, but there are some awesome references to a certain popular gaming franchise in the final stage. 

Once you finish the story mode and clean up your pants, you are now ready for the meat of the true game. Endless mode! This is exactly the same setup as the story mode sans boss fight. If you couldn't guess by the name, it just goes on and on until you die. You will still have various cd parts to complete new soundtracks while you challenge your best score. I managed to get over 40,000,000 once, and have yet to best myself. The action just constantly gets more intense until you cant take it anymore. 

Time attack was simply a test of how fast you are able to clear stages by killing all the enemies. I have never been much for time attack modes and found very little innovation here. It was very considerate of the developer to cater to that crowd. There are many very avid time attack players out there that will blow your mind with skillful, yet torridly fast completions. 

So what do we have here? A fast paced game. A fun game. A low priced game. I paid $2 on the steam store for my copy of Savant Ascent and have loved every second of it. I will mention that I ran into a few minor UI glitches that were in no way game breaking. That aside, this is a special treat in a world dominated by games that want to baby you with tutorials the whole way through. You can play this game for 20 minutes and accomplish something, or you can dive in for hours if that is your choosing. It is always there to tailor to your specific needs. That, my friends, is a mighty fine deal! 

I write for Beast League Gaming!

https://www.facebook.com/BeastLeagueGaming

11998529.review:
Savant - Ascent est un shoot'em up 2D développé par DPad Studio, un studio indépendant. Initialement le jeu propose une mode histoire composé de 3 niveaux dont le niveau du boss. Une fois le mode histoire terminé, vous aurez accès à deux autres modes : le mode "Time Attack" dont le but sera de finir la partie avec le meilleur chrono et le mode "Endless" où il faudra rester en vie le plus longtemps possible.

Dans un premier temps, vous verrez qu'il sera bien difficile de finir le jeu, malgré sa durée très courte. Les ennemis arrivent à un rythme effreiné, sans que vous ayez fi en finir avec les précédents. Votre objectif sera alors d'améliorer votre personnage en récupérant des 4 fragments de CD qui vous donneront une nouvelle capacité, facilitant ainsi votre progression. Dans le mode histoire vous pouvez améliorer votre personnage 4 fois (ce qui fait 16 fragments à récupérer).

Le gameplay est assez original, vous visez avec votre souris, vous tirez avec le click gauche de la souris, et vous n'avez que 2 positions possible pour votre personnage où vous pouvez y accéder soit en glissant du côté droit au côté gauche (et inversement), soit en sautant.

Bien que difficile de prime abord, Savant - Ascent est le genre de jeu dans lequel il faut perseverer pour en profiter pleinement dans le mode histoire. Cependant une fois les 4 améliorations effectuées, le mode histoire devient trop court et trop facile. Intelligemment les développeur ont caché 2 autres améliorations à acquérir dans les autres modes, ce qui augmente considérablement la durée de vie et le challenge. La difficulté ressentie à vos débuts reviendra vous hanter, relançant l'intérêt et l'espoir d'améliorer son niveau de jeu.

Côté succès, il ne va pas suffire de finir le simple mode histoire, mais aller bien au delà. C'est un peu dommage de ne pas avoir quelques récompense dans le niveau histoire surtout que le jeu ne comporte que 14 succès.

Graphiquement, Savant - Ascent est très agréable, et vous plonge dans un univers à mi-chemin entre un Castelvania et V pour Vendetta. Là ou certain studio indé se limite au style pixélisé, ici vous aurez droit à des sprites de qualité.

Savant - Ascent, un Easy-to-Finish Hard-to-Master, comme le sont la plupart des bons jeux. Un rythme endiablé, des graphismes de qualité, un jeu original qui vaut le détour et tout ça pour 2€. Le bémol restera toujours ce mode histoire bien trop court.

11922490.review:
Below you'll find both a video and written impression on the game.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2mXDHaZ31rM

Savant features brilliant visuals, audio, and simple but challenging and addictive gameplay. It's only 2 bucks, and the meat of the game is fantastic! Honestly, you can stop reading now, sacrifice just one vending machine trip, and purchase the game, it's good.

But if you want to know more, then know this. Though the game play is enjoyable, and the presentation top shelf, it's a small game. There's not a lot in the way of extra features, even the options menu is relatively lacking, and I suspect the difficulty, though satisfying, was cranked up to hide the game's low content. But with that said, know that what is there, is exceptionally well crafted! Think of it as fine cuisine. You get just enough to be full, and while you were tasting it, it was some of the best you've had, except this game doesn't come at the cost of fine cuisine!

If you've made it this far into the impression, just ignore every thing you read and buy the damn game. Once again... It's good!

Pros:
- Simple but challenging and addictive gameplay
- Fantastic audio!
- Twitchy gameplay!
- Fancy buzzword visuals!
- It's the cost of a damn candy bar!

Cons:
- Low price, means low content
- Options menu could use an overhaul

11684742.review:
Savant - Ascent is a interesting take on the shmup genre. It is more a defense game than anything, as you only move from one spot on the level or another, and become stationary at either point. The wizard must shoot enemies and ...things that drop pieces of records. Getting full records upgrades your firepower (I think) and advances the stage. You're essentially a turret that can jump or move to another point on the level, as you shoot in 360 degrees while dealing with a limited screenview that requires you to be catious and prioritize certain targets as the enemies have different attack patterns. The limited vision is very annoying for me, but I can see that it was an intentional design decision. It's unfortunate that I can't play it full screen or expand it to my 2560x1080 resolution. I don't really get why there is a gothic, Castlevania-like visual theme mixed with Dubstep and 8 bit sound bytes. Savant has a nice style, but it's strange.

The game is pretty fun and it's mostly a hardcore score attacker's delight. The game is absolutely brutal, and I can't get past the 2nd level for the life of me. I might be able to get further if I really hunker down and practice this game for hours, but I don't feel like doing that at the moment. It's a solid game, especially for $2 or less, but realize that you're getting a very simplistic and hardcore, almost arcade like experience that has an extremely short story mode (From what I read) and an endless mode that is just about score and survival. .

11456040.review: Savant Ascent is a twin stick shooter with amazing music but will you want to play this game ? In Savant Ascent you play as Savant. A mystical orb cast him out of his tower so now he has to fight his way back to the top. So how is this game ? Honestly its quite fun. The game is played like a twin stick shooter but you play with a mouse. Essiantly you have three levels of killing stuff to get back to the top. In the game you have to kill robots and collect CD parts to get power ups. The game also has an endless mode which is alot of fun. The game has a kick ass soundtrack with great toons which you listen while killing alot of enemies. The game also has a few flaws. The game doesnt explain how to kill the final boss so it takes quite a bit of time to get it right. The game is also quite difficult. Overall theres nothing more to say about this little gem. 11437410.review:
I for one loved this game. Completely. This was possibly the best example of a music action game I have seen in a long time, even up against games like Beat Hazard and Audiosurf, two classics that are by no means easy to conquer themselves. 
This game has an amazing sound-track that you won't soon forget, even if you don't like the genre; it fits the pixelled graphics so well you almost feel no other music could have ever belonged on this game. 

Mechanic wise, it's a simple but brilliant system; protect yourself from enemies by shooting and dodging. What makes it brilliant, you ask? Several reasons.
1. You have only 2 platforms on which to move about, with 2 ways of achieving movement between them (Jumping through the air or just dodging left and right.)
2. The number of enemies you face in even just the campaign makes this beat-based defense tricky. 

Even when you can predict /when/ the enemy is coming, can you predict how many and where from? Not without some practice and those ever precious Gold CD's that give you even cooler music to work with as well as powering up your Alchemist.

I reccomend buying this even at full price.

Para mi este juego es de lo mejor, al estilo antiguo de 8 Bits,(aunque en este juego se ve mucho mejor), con las mismisimas canciones de Aleksander Vinter(Savant) y con distindos modos de juego. Para mi valio la pena comprarlo,cuando ya terminas el modo historia, luego puedes jugar al modo interminable, tratando de superarte a ti mismo y a los demas, ya que contiene un modo de records global. O tambien el modo de tiempo de ataque, que tratas de pasar el juego en el menor tiempo posible, tambien contiene el modo global. Ademas trae otros modos de juego que se liberan al pasar la historia.
Yo lo recomiendo, ademas de su bajo precio, es un juego tipo shooter castlevania que te hara pasar ratos de entretenimiento y adrenalina al tratar de superar tus records y los records de los demas.

11427899.review: Savant: Ascent has a lot of promise. For the price of the game, it is a EXTREMELY well made game, which if put on a mobile platform would put other mobile games to shame. But, even with this game's extreme high points, with it's beautiful art, and beautiful music, the game really is only a time waster. The added modes are helpful in keeping one entertained, however the game does lacks in essence and content. My main complaint is that what should be a more satisfying part of the game (I.E. The Story Mode) feels more like a longer, dragged out version of the Time attack and Endless Modes. I was there where more sections added onto the game, which would allow that final boss to be much more intense and satisfying. I also wish that I knew more about the background lore in the world of which the devs had made. Who was Savant? How is he able to shoot light energy from his hands? and what's the background of the villian, Vario? This game has much potential into being something great, but I would think that the game needs a little bit more content before I consider it a full game. None the less, for the price of a whopping $1.99, I think the game is very much worth giving a try. 7.5/10

11226306.review:
Ohhhhh boy.  I really like this game.  No, you don't understand...I REALLY like this game.  It was like a breath of fresh air after trying to play a bunch of boring, generic titles...Savant is anything but boring.  Guy faux victorian hero Savant throwing DBZ style energy blasts while riding an elevator up a tower fighting metal monsters and collecting music while rocking out to the amazing sound track...yeah, not boring.

A lot of people mighty scoff at this game because the basic story mode can be beaten in under ten minutes...however, the game's true fun lies in replays, high scores, time attack, and the endless battle mode.  Savant is a game that is short, but is almost more replayable than a 60 hour rpg because it is just plain fun.  It is arcade fun with an AMAZING sound track.  Even with the apparently short length, I have got to give this game the thumbs up.

Besides, it's 1.99.  That's pocket change for a truly unique, fun game.  I may not put in a huge number of hours in Savant, but I will go back to it, because it is just fun and I don't regret my purchase.  Not one bit.

Also, my time in this game is about 30 minutes so far, dunno why it's saying zero hours.  Anyway, gonna go play some more.  LATER!

A Surprisingly fun and addictive arcade style throwback, based on the EDM artist Savant and his music. 

The story mode is short and sweet, dropping you straight into the action fighting off waves of unique and challenging enemies. 
Don't let the length put you off though -- The story line mainly serves as a way to introduce you to the game mechanics and unlockable special abilities of your character... something you'll need to master before the REAL fun starts in Endless mode. 

Enemies have different traits, attack patterns and weaknesses, all of which you'll need to learn to counter in order to progress up the tower. Collecting the CD pieces unlocks Savant soundtracks, and more importantly, new special abilities.
There is no grind, you'll have unlocked all the abilities before the top of the tower... (likely well before that)

Stop reading reviews and buy this damn game jerk.

11013720.review:
Savant Ascent. When I dropped the .99 on this back in Winter I was simply looking for a new game but couldn't justify dropping $5 or more. But what I got was an experience. Savant is an artist I'm familiar with, having listened to each of his albums so when I was introduced to this game I was a bit excited to see what lay in store. The beginning is challenging, especially learning controls and then applying them but it does get a lot easier when you level up in game by obtaining new tracks. The game for its price contains a fair amount of content. A standard story mode, a reprise after you complete the standard mode, a skin change for the enemies and finally the endless mode. You'll breeze through the first 2 and thereby obtain the 3rd quite easily but the real challenge comes in Endless. The real incentive for that is to collect the final tracks that aren't available in the story mode.

tl;dr
For the price you could do MUCH worse, heck you could do much worse for more than that. If you're into shooters, and want a small time killer game with a good soundtrack, then give Savant Aascent a try.
